during the period of time that the county shall provide such services agreement between the county and the city shall be set by resolution of the county council penalties for violation the violation of any of the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction be punishable as provided in section 115 the city in addition to other remedies set forth herein shall have the right to equitable or injunctive relief or such other legal or equitable remedy provided by law certificate of competency required no person or firm shall engage in business as a construction contractor mechanical contractor andor plumbing contractor as defined in this article in the city without having a valid certificate of competency and license issued by the county or being certified by the state as defined in fs ch 489 exh a 2707 rules of construction a rules and definitions  generally the rules set out in this section shall be observed unless such construction is inconsistent with the manifest intent of this chapter the rules of construction and definitions set out here shall not be applied to any section of this chapter which contains any express provisions excluding such construction or where the subject matter or content of such section would be inconsistent with this section delegation of authority whenever a provision appears requiring the building official or some other officer or employee to do some act or perform some duty it is to be construed to authorize the building official or other officer to designate delegate and authorize professionallevel subordinates to perform the required act or duty unless the terms of the provision or section specify otherwise generally all provisions terms phrases and expressions contained in this article shall be liberally construed in order that the true intent and meaning of the administration of the jurisdiction may be fully carried out terms used in this article unless otherwise specifically provided shall have the meanings prescribed by the statutes of this state for the same terms interpretation interpretations of this chapter shall be made by the building official month the word month shall mean calendar month text in case of any difference of meaning or implication between the text of this article and any figure the text shall control written or in writing the term written or in writing shall be construed to include any representation of words letters or figures whether by printing or otherwise b words not defined words not defined herein shall have the meaning stated in the florida statutes or other nationally recognized codes or other documents manuals or standards adopted elsewhere in this chapter words not defined in those documents shall have the meaning stated in the websters ninth new collegiate dictionary as revised in case of a conflict in definitions or codes the appropriate definition or code to be applied shall be the one applicable to the trade in question in case of a conflict between different parts of this chapter  conflicts within the same code  or conflicts between codes  the more stringent requirements shall be applicable c words defined abandon or abandonment 1 termination of a construction project by a contractor without just cause or proper notification to the owner including the reason for termination 2 failure of a contractor to perform work without just cause for 90 days 3 failure to obtain an approved inspection within 180 days from the previous approved inspection appraised value for the purpose of this section appraised value is defined as either 1 one hundred twenty percent of the assessed value of the structure as indicated by the property appraiser  or 2 the value as indicated in a certified appraisal from a certified appraiser assessed value the value of real property and improvements thereon as established by the property appraiser authorized agent a person specifically authorized by the holder of a certificate of competency to obtain permits in his stead board the board of adjustment and appeals unless otherwise specifically stated building component an element or assembly of elements integral to or part of a building building shell the structural components that completely enclose a building including but not limited to the foundation structural frame floor slabs exterior walls and roof system building system a functionally related group of elements components andor equipment such as the electrical plumbing and mechanical systems of a building certification the act or process of obtaining a certificate of competency from the state or municipality review of the applicants experience and financial responsibility as well as successful passage of an examination certificate of competency certificate an official document evidencing that a person is qualified to engage in the business of contracting subcontracting or the work of a specific trade certificate of experience an official document evidencing that an applicant has satisfied the work experience requirements for a certificate of competency certificate of occupancy co an official document evidencing that a building satisfies the requirements of the jurisdiction for the occupancy of a building certified contractor any contractor who possesses a certificate of competency issued by the department of business and professional regulation of the state change of occupancy a change from one building code occupancy classification or subclassification to another commercial building any building structure improvement or accessory thereto other than a one or twofamily dwelling cumulative construction cost the sum total of costs associated with any construction work done to a building or structure either at one time or at different times within a specified period of time demolition the act of razing dismantling or removal of a building or structure or portion thereof to the ground level examination an exam prepared proctored and graded by a recognized testing agency unless otherwise implied in context or specifically stated otherwise fcilb the florida construction industry licensing board imminent danger structurally unsound conditions of a structure or portion thereof that is likely to cause physical injury to a person entering the structure  or due to structurally unsound conditions any portion of the structure is likely to fall be carried by the wind or otherwise detach or move and in doing so cause physical injury or damage to a person on the property or to a person or property nearby  or the condition of the property is such that it harbors or is inhabited by pests vermin or organisms injurious to human health the presence of which constitutes an immediate hazard to people in the vicinity inspection warrant a court order authorizing the official or his designee to perform an inspection of a particular property named in the warrant intensification of use an increase in capacity or number of units of a residential or commercial building interior finish the preparation of interior spaces of a commercial building for the first occupancy thereof licensed contractor a contractor certified by the state or the local jurisdiction who has satisfied all state or local requirements to be actively engaged in contracting market value as defined in floodplain regulations of this code owners agent a person firm or entity authorized in writing by the owner to act for or in place of the owner permit an official document authorizing performance of a specific activity regulated by this chapter permit card or placard a document issued by the jurisdiction evidencing the issuance of a permit and recording of inspections qualifying agent primary a person who possesses the requisite skill knowledge experience and certificate of competency and has the responsibility to supervise direct manage and control the contracting activities of the business organization with which he is associated  who has the responsibility to supervise direct manage and control construction activities on a job for which he has obtained a permit  and whose technical and personal qualifications have been determined by investigation and examination and is evidenced by his possession of a certificate of competency qualifying agent secondary a person who possesses the requisite skill knowledge experience and certificate of competency and has the responsibility to supervise direct manage and control construction activities on a job for which he has obtained a permit and whose technical and personal qualifications have been determined by investigation and examination and is evidenced by his possession of a certificate of competency reciprocity to accept a verified affidavit from any municipality or county of the state that the applicant has satisfactorily completed a written examination in its jurisdiction equal in content with the examination required by this chapter registered contractor a contractor who has registered with the department of business and professional regulation of the state pursuant to fulfilling the competency requirements of the local jurisdiction registration the act or process of registering a locally obtained certificate of competency with the state or the act or process of registering a state issued certificate of competency with the municipality remodeling work which changes the original size configuration or material of the components of a building residential building any one or twofamily building or accessory roofing the installation of roof coverings spa any constructed or prefabricated pool containing water jets specialty contractor a contractor whose services do not fall within the categories specified in fs  3 start of construction site the physical clearing of the site in preparation for foundation work including but not limited to site clearing excavation dewatering pilings and soil testing activities building the removal disassembly repair replacement installation or assembly of the building structure building system or building components in whole or parts thereof stopwork order an order by the building official or his designee which requires the immediate cessation of all work and work activities described in the order structural component any part of a system building or structure loadbearing or nonloadbearing which is integral to the structural integrity thereof including but not limited to walls partitions columns beams and girders structural work or alteration the installation or assembling of new structural components into a system building or structure also any change repair or replacement of any existing structural component of a system building or structure substantial completion where the construction work has been sufficiently completed in accordance with the applicable city state and federal codes so that the owner can occupy or utilize the project for the use for which it is intended value job cost exh a 2707 permitting and inspection the inspection or permitting of any building system or plan by the jurisdiction under the requirements of this code shall not be construed in any court as a warranty of the physical condition of such building system or plan or their adequacy exh a 2707 powers and duties of the building official a general the building official is hereby authorized and directed to enforce the provisions of this code the building official shall have the authority to render interpretations of this code and to adopt policies and procedures in order to clarify the application of its provisions such interpretations policies and procedures shall be in compliance with the intent and purpose of this code and shall not have the effect of waiving requirements specifically provided for in this code b right of entry whenever necessary to make an inspection to enforce any of the provisions of this code or whenever the building official has reasonable cause to believe that there exists in any building or upon any premises any condition or code violation which makes such building structure premises electrical gas mechanical or plumbing systems unsafe dangerous or hazardous the building official may enter such building structure or premises at all reasonable times to inspect the same or to perform any duty imposed upon the building official by this code if such building or premises are occupied he or she shall first present proper credentials and request entry if such building structure or premises are unoccupied he or she shall first make a reasonable effort to locate the owner or other persons having charge or control of such and request entry if entry is refused the building official shall have recourse to every remedy provided by law to secure entry when the building official shall have first obtained a proper inspection warrant or other remedy provided by law to secure entry no owner or occupant or any other persons having charge care or control of any building structure or premises shall fail or neglect after proper request is made as herein provided to promptly permit entry therein by the building official for the purpose of inspection and examination pursuant to this code c stopwork orders upon notice from the building official work on any building structure electrical gas mechanical or plumbing system that is being done contrary to the provisions of this code or in a dangerous or unsafe manner shall immediately cease such notice shall be in writing and shall be given to the owner of the property or to his agent or to the person doing the work and shall state the conditions under which work may be resumed where an emergency exists the building official shall not be required to give a written notice prior to stopping the work d revocation of permits the building official is authorized to suspend or revoke a permit issued under the provisions of this code wherever the permit is issued in error or on the basis of incorrect inaccurate or incomplete information or in violation of any ordinance or regulation or any provisions of this code e misrepresentation of application the building official may revoke a permit or approval issued under the provisions of this code in case there has been any false statement or misrepresentation as to the material fact in the application or plans on which the permit or approval was based f violation of code provisions the building official may revoke a permit upon determination by the building official that the construction erection alteration repair moving demolition installation or replacement of the building structure electrical gas mechanical or plumbing systems for which the permit was issued is in violation of or not in conformity with the provisions of this code g requirements not covered by code any requirements necessary for the strength stability or proper operation of an existing or proposed building structure electrical gas mechanical or plumbing system or for the public safety health and general welfare not specifically covered by this or the other technical codes shall be determined by the building official exh a 2707 mobile home setup and installation a any mobile home setup or placement contractor or subcontractor engaged in the operation of locating setting or placing a mobile home on any authorized mobile home lot within the city shall hereby be registered or properly licensed with the city when obtaining a permit the contractor or subcontractor shall engage and utilize a cityapproved electrician plumber mechanical or gas contractor for each installation b it shall be the responsibility of any mobile home setup or placement contractor or subcontractor to assure that the mobile home situated and tied down on any approved lot shall adhere to all city and state requirements regarding tiedowns setbacks and proper hookups exh a 2707 state law reference mobile home tiedown and installation requirements fs   sand and soil retention on construction sites a a temporary solid nonporous fence measuring at least six feet high shall be placed around the perimeter of all construction sites in the city prior to any construction excavation and demolition in order to prevent the migration and movement of loose sand soil and construction debris from such construction sites to neighboring properties or adjoining roads as a result of high winds and heavy rains fencing shall also be sufficiently high to be above any sand level on the property the fence will be constructed of concrete properly braced plywood stockade or board and batten fences the design engineer or architect shall certify that the fence will withstand 110mileperhour wind loads fences will be painted tan with no advertisement street addresses will be placed on the fence near the entrance of the construction site plastic fabric material or snow fencing is prohibited those sections of fence that must be removed to allow entry or exit of equipment or materials will be replaced as soon as possible and in any event replacement shall be completed prior to the end of the same workday that the fence was removed b the method of compliance shall be demonstrated to the building official or his designee prior to the issuance of a permit the building official may waive the requirement of this section if windblown sand soil or debris is not a potential problem ie construction does not include site work exposing sand or the property is surrounded sufficiently by heavy vegetation to preclude drifting or blowing sand soil or debris c where permitted construction is not in compliance with the provisions of this section the code administrator shall issue a stopwork order prohibiting further construction until compliance with this section is demonstrated in periods of emergency or severe weather the code administrator may require or take emergency temporary measures to prevent the movement or migration of sand soil or construction debris etc onto neighboring properties or adjoining streets and charge the permittee the reasonable cost of taking such measures d these requirements for sand fences shall in no way relieve the owners of vacant properties from providing sand fences as described above or vegetation to prevent migration of sand soil debris etc to adjacent properties or streets property owners are responsible for maintaining the property so as not to create a nuisance or unsightly condition to occur on either his property or adjacent properties the requirement for fencing and the standards for fence construction affect all construction sites e required sand fencing shall be removed when vegetation or other sand and soil stabilization is sufficient as determined by the development code administrator to adequately control migration and movement of sand secs 1491430  reserved article ii  adoption of building and other administration derived from ii adopted feb 6 2002 state law reference florida building codes act fs  55370 et seq division 1  generally adopted there is hereby adopted by the city for the purpose of establishing rules and regulations for the construction maintenance and repair of buildings including permits and penalties that certain code known as the florida building published by the florida building commission except as amended in this article copies of the subject code have been and now are filed in the office of the city clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out in length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall control within the limits of the town all permits issued by the city of debary or county of volusia as acting agent for new construction of residential and commercial projects shall be governed by the time limitations as described in the florida building model administration administration conditions of the permit in particular subsection  provides the following  permit intent a permit issued shall be construed to be a license to proceed with the work and not as authority to violate cancel alter or set aside any of the provisions of the technical codes nor shall issuance of a permit prevent the building official from thereafter requiring a correction of errors in plans construction or violations of this code every permit issued shall become invalid unless the work authorized by such permit is commenced within 6 months after its issuance or if the work authorized by such permit is suspended or abandoned for a period of 6 months after the time the work is commenced failure to obtain an approved inspection within 180 days of the previous approved inspection shall constitute suspension or abandonment one or more extensions of time for periods not more than 180 days each may be allowed by the building official for the permit provided the extension is requested in writing and justifiable cause is demonstrated prior to the expiration date the building official shall record the extension of time granted in addition to subsection  of the boaf model administration all permits inclusive of all extensions for new construction of residential and commercial projects shall be null and void two years and one day after date of issuance and shall be deemed noncompliant the expiration date will appear on the permit no work shall be performed under a noncompliant permit any person performing work under a noncompliant permit shall be in violation of this section and will be sent a notice to appear before the city code enforcement board exh a 2707 permit fees the building permit fees shall be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 local provisions of of the florida building building or as applicable the provisions of r322 of the florida building residential this section shall not apply to of the florida building building modify as follows r elevation requirements 1 buildings and structures in flood hazard areas not designated as coastal a zones shall have the lowest floors elevated to or above the base flood elevation plus 1 foot or the design flood elevation or 12 inches above the crown of all adjacent roads whichever is higher 2 buildings and structures in flood hazard areas designated as coastal a zones shall have the lowest floors elevated to or above the base flood elevation plus 1 foot 305 mm or to the design flood elevation whichever is higher 3 in areas of shallow flooding ao zones buildings and structures shall have the lowest floor including basement elevated at least as high above the highest adjacent grade as the depth number specified in feet on the firm plus 1 foot  or at least 3 feet 2 feet 610mm if a depth number is not specified or 12 inches above the crown of all adjacent roads whichever is higher 4 basement floors that are below grade on all sides shall be elevated to or above the base flood elevation plus 1 foot or the design flood elevation or 12 inches above the crown of all adjacent roads whichever is higher exception enclosed areas below the design flood elevation including basements whose floors are not below grade on all sides shall meet the requirements of modify as follows r elevation requirements 1 all buildings and structures erected within coastal highhazard areas shall be elevated so that the lowest portion of all structural members supporting the lowest floor with the exception of mat or raft foundations piling pile caps columns grade beams and bracing is 11 located at or above the base flood elevation plus 1 foot the design flood elevation or 12 inches above the crown of all adjacent roads whichever is higher if the lowest horizontal structural member is oriented parallel to the direction of wave approach where parallel shall mean less than or equal to 20 degrees 035 rad from the direction of approach or 12 located at the base flood elevation plus 2 feet 1 foot 305mm  or the design flood elevation whichever is higher if the lowest horizontal structural member is oriented perpendicular to the direction of wave approach where perpendicular shall mean greater than 20 degrees 035 rad from the direction of approach 2 basement floors that are below grade on all sides are prohibited 3 the use of fill for structural support is prohibited 4 minor grading and the placement of minor quantities of fill shall be permitted for landscaping and for drainage purposes under and around buildings and for support of parking slabs pool decks patios and walkways exception walls and partitions enclosing areas below the design flood elevation shall meet the requirements of r  2 2514 secs 14341440  reserved division 2  electrical code adopted there are hereby adopted by the city the terms and conditions set forth and embraced within the florida building to the regulation of electrical systems copies of the subject code being on file in the office of the city clerk the terms and conditions set forth within the booklet are hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out in length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall control within the limits of the city exh a 2707 temporary power a the building official may permit temporary connecting of any system of wiring either during the course of construction or for temporary light heat power or advertising provided that no temporary connection shall be for a period of time over 30 days or such time as shall be specified in writing by the electrical inspector construction power shall be a minimum of 70 amps 220 volts and shall provide one 50amp threewire 200volt single phase receptacle and one 15amp 110volt threewire receptacle these receptacles shall have separate and proper overload protection b the building official may give special permission to connect and furnish electric current to any wiring apparatus or fixtures for a period of not exceeding 30 days if in his opinion such wiring apparatus or fixtures are in such condition that current may be safely connected therewith and there exists an urgent necessity for such use c the building official may issue special permits for the installation and use of temporary wiring andor equipment as permitted by subsection b of this section provided that the use of such temporary wiring andor equipment shall be limited to a period of not more than 30 days after the date of the permit if reasonable necessity is established for an extension of time in the use of such temporary wiring andor equipment the permit for such use may be extended by the electrical inspector for an additional period of 30 days from its original date of expiration but permission for the use of such temporary installation shall in no case be extended for a greater period of time than 90 days after the date of issuance of the original permit exh a 2707 permit fees the building permit fees shall be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 insurance any master electrician entering into an agreement with any person for consideration either for a fixed contract price or a costplus basis or for anything of value or for a supervising fee or for a management fee or for a commission to supervise the installation of electrical wiring apparatus of equipment for light heat power or advertising as covered by the terms and provisions of this article shall be held and considered to be carrying on the business of electrical contracting and shall be required to furnish sufficient insurance in the amount of $10000000 general liability for each person plus $30000000 for each accident exh a 2707 secs 14451450  reserved division 3  plumbing code adopted there is set out at length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city exh a 2707 permit fees the building permit fees shall be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 secs 14531460  reserved divison 4  gas code adopted there is hereby adopted by the city that certain code known as the florida building as published by the florida building commission copies of the subject code are filed in the office of the city clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out a length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city exh a 2707 permit fees the building permit fees shall be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 secs 14631470  reserved division 5  swimming pool code adopted there is hereby adopted by the city that certain code known as the florida building as published by the florida building commission copies of the subject code are filed in the office of the city clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city exh a 2707 permit fees the building permit fees shall be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 aboveground pool safety barrier all pools constructed above ground are required to have an additional barrier around the pool area to ensure compliance with the swimming pool code as adopted such additional requirements may include a fence around property fencing must meet barrier requirements screen enclosure of the pool area etc in either case the barrier must be approved by the city exh a 2707 permits there is hereby established a permit for the installation of residential solar water heaters and residential solar swimming pool heaters said permit may be issued only to licensed residential solar water heating contractors andor specialty structure contractors except that a homeowner may pull his permit for the installation of a solar water or pool heater andor construction of their own specialty structure on his own home for the personal noncommercial use provided that the homeowner actually performs the work and is solely responsible therefor and provided that the work done shall conform with all applicable codes and ordinances pertaining to construction within the county exh a 2707 secs 14751480  reserved division 6  unsafe building abatement code adopted there is hereby adopted by the city that certain code known as the unsafe building abatement being the 1985 seventh edition thereof as published by the southern building international inc copies of the subject code are filed in the office of the city clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city exh a 2707 secs 14821485  reserved division 7  excavation and grading code adopted there is hereby adopted by the city that certain code known as the standard excavation and grading being the 1975 edition thereof as published by the southern building international inc copies of the subject code are filed in the office of the city clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the city exh a 2707 amendments the standard excavation and grading by this article is amended in the following respects permits required is amended to read as follows no person firm corporation or entity shall do any grading or excavation without having first obtained a grading or excavation permit from the building official except for the following 1 grading in an isolated selfcontained area if there is no danger apparent to private or public property 2 an excavation below finished grade for basements and footings of a building retaining walls or other structures authorized by a valid building permit this shall not exempt any fill made with the material from such excavation or exempt any excavation having an unsupported height greater than five feet after the completion of such structure 3 cemetery graves 4 refuse disposal sites controlled by other regulations 5 excavation for wells or tunnels or utilities 6 exploratory excavations under the direction of soil engineering or engineering geologists 7 violation of the requirements of this section shall in addition to the penalties provided for in this code subject the violator to cancellation of any building permit previously issued exh a 2707 fees fees under the standard excavation and grading be as presently established or as hereafter amended by resolution of the council exh a 2707 penalty any person violating any of the provisions of this article division shall upon conviction thereof be subject to the penalties designated in section 111 each day such violation is committed or permitted to continue shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as such under this section exh a 2707 stopwork orders  emergency measures any construction excavation or grading which is not in compliance with the provisions of this article division the standard excavation and grading shall be subject to the issuance of a stopwork order by the chief building official which prohibits further construction until compliance with such provisions is demonstrated in periods of emergency or severe weather the chief building official may take temporary measures to remove and alleviate any hazards created by violations of such provisions and charge the applicant permittee or owner the reasonable costs of taking such emergency measures a possession and display of permit a copy of the permit shall be kept in the possession of any operator of earthmoving or bulldozing equipment and shall be displayed to any police officer of the town or other town official upon request b enforcement every police officer or other official of the city who shall observe any operation subject to this section being commenced shall immediately request the operator to display the permit required by this section if the operator fails to so display the permit then the work shall be immediately halted until compliance with this section is made if the operator or any other person acting under or on behalf of the project proponent shall nevertheless continue the project without complying with this section the operator shall be cited by the officer for violation c removing or damaging protected tree if any person shall with knowledge of the requirements of this section to the extent that the state or county forester shall deem it probable that it will die damage or remove any protected tree he shall pay a penalty of $50000 for each such protected tree damaged or removed and shall be required to replace such tree to the satisfaction of the forester in addition the chief building official shall stay all additional work on the land until such fine be paid and replacement be made d penalty violation of any provision of this section shall be punished as provided in section 111 in addition to the penalties provided in subsection e when applicable e surveying and other predevelopment activities no motorized land clearing equipment shall be used for surveying and other predevelopment activities survey operations are restricted to handheld brush and tree removal equipment methods f maximum extent of excavation and grading excavation and grading shall be restricted to a maximum of ten percent of the mean elevation within a 25foot radius of center this is to ensure that the least amount of soil removal is accomplished and that maximum dune and natural contour occur to provide protection from storms and high water deviation from this requirement in areas of severe elevation differentials will be addressed during the subdivision review process any such deviation from this requirement in the event of severe elevation differentials must be approved by a vote of at least four members of the town council during the subdivision review process exh a 2707 demonstration of compliance  excavation and grading prohibited on certain days a no excavation or grading shall be permitted nor shall any excavation or grading permit be issued for singlefamily residential property unless a building permit for singlefamily construction has been issued and the applicant demonstrates with competent evidence that the excavation grading and construction will not result in the movement of sand soil refuse litter discarded building materials and unused building materials onto neighboring properties or adjoining public roads sidewalks or bike paths b no excavation or grading shall be permitted nor shall any excavation or grading permit be issued for any other property within the town unless the applicant demonstrates with competent evidence that such excavation grading and construction will not result in the movement of sand soil refuse litter discarded building materials and unused building materials onto neighboring properties or adjoining public roads sidewalks or bike paths or the applicant demonstrates with competent evidence a satisfactory method of retaining sand soil refuse litter discarded building materials and unused building materials on the site of excavation grading or construction which prevents movement of these materials onto neighboring properties or adjoining public roads sidewalks or bike paths the applicant must comply with the site plan review requirements of the land use and development code part iii of this volume where applicable c no excavation and grading regardless of whether or not a permit is required for such excavation and grading shall be permitted in the city on saturdays sundays or legal holidays exh a 2707 stabilization and protection of land during road development and construction a all future and existing road cuts must be stabilized to prevent erosion of the dune system and prevent destruction of or damage to existing vegetation if road development and construction requires cuts dune structures or the natural contours of land the cut areas of the land must be stabilized and protected with retaining walls or other suitable construction methods approved by the town and in accordance with sound and accepted environmental standards b if road development and construction results in the filling of land areas beyond the extent of the platted rightofway the developer must take adequate measures and precautions to protect and replace when necessary existing natural vegetation in accordance with sound environmental and engineering standards exh a 2707 secs 1494 1495  reserved division 8  housing code adopted there is hereby adopted by the town that certain code known as the standard housing being the 1994 edition thereof as published by the southern building international inc copies of the subject code are filed in the office of the town clerk and such code is hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length in this section and the provisions contained therein shall be controlling within the limits of the town exh a 2707 reserved division 9  maintenance code adopted except as added to deleted modified or amended herein the city hereby adopts as the property maintenance the city of debary the most current edition of the international property maintenance edition first printing as prepared edited and published by the international inc and incorporates the same by reference as if fully set forth herein copies of such property maintenance code together with this division shall be made available for reference in the office of the city clerk of the city of debary  91510 amendments certain sections and portions of sections of the international property maintenance edition as adopted in section 1498 of this are hereby amended deleted modified or added as stated herein and shall have full force and effect as if set therein 1 is hereby added shall be entitled adoption and shall read as follows these regulations shall be known as the property maintenance the city of debary hereinafter referred to as this code 2 entitled fees is hereby deleted in its entirety 3 entitled weeds shall remain numbered and titled as such but the content thereof is deleted and the following text shall be substituted therefor all premises and exterior property shall be maintained free from weeds or plant growth in excess of ten 10 inches 4 entitled insect screens shall remain numbered and titled as such but the content thereof is deleted and the following text shall be substituted therefor yearround every door window and other outside opening required for ventilation of habitable rooms food preparation areas food service areas or any other areas where products to be included or utilized in food for human consumption are processed manufactured packaged or stored shall be supplied with approved tightly fitting screens of not less than 16 mesh per inch 16 mesh per 25 mm and every screen door for insect control shall have a selfclosing device in good working condition 5 entitled heat supply shall remain numbered and titled as such but the content thereof is deleted and the following text shall be substituted therefor every owner and operator of any building who rents leases or lets one or more dwelling units or sleeping units on terms either expressed or implied to furnish heat to the occupants thereof shall supply heat during the period from november 1 st to march 30 th sufficient to maintain a temperature of not less than 68 degrees fahrenheit in all habitable rooms bathrooms and toilet rooms 6 entitled occupiable work spaces shall remain numbered and titled as such but the content thereof is deleted and the following text shall be substituted therefor indoor occupiable work spaces shall be supplied with heat during the period of november 1 st to march 30 th sufficient to maintain a temperature of not less than 68 degrees fahrenheit during the period the spaces are occupied 7 supplemental code  the provisions of this code shall be supplemental to all other codes and other ordinances of the city  91510 reserved article iii  unlicensed contractors footnotes  3  editors note  adopted feb 7 200 amended art iii in its entirety and enacted similar provisions as set out herein the former art iii derived from ord no 0300  i adopted  unlawful acts it shall be unlawful for any person to violate the provisions of fs  1 48913 1 or 1 exh a 2707 secs 1410214110  reserved article iv  licensed contractors board footnotes  4  editors note  adopted feb 7 200 amended art iv in its entirety and enacted the provisions set out herein the former art iv titled licensed contractors derived from  adopted  creation there is hereby created a city building trades board which shall be composed of 1 one construction contractor who must be a general residential or building contractor  2 one master electrician  3 one master plumber  4 one mechanical contractor or a class a air conditioning contractor  5 one architect registered in the state or if no such person is willing to serve then any person licensed by fs ch 489 part i or ii  6 one engineer registered in the state or if no such person is willing to serve then any person licensed by fs ch 489 part i or ii  and 7 three representatives who have never been members or practitioners of a profession regulated by the board or members of any closelyrelated profession exh a 2707 term of office a terms the initial appointments to the board shall be as follows 1 three members appointed for a term of one year 2 three members appointed for a term of two years 3 three members appointed for a term of three years thereafter all appointments shall be made for a term of three years board appointments shall be made by the city council no elected official or employee of the city shall be appointed to serve on the board a member may be reappointed upon approval of the city council b vacancies in the event of a vacancy on the board the city council shall appoint a new member to serve out the remainder of the term if any member fails to attend two of three successive meetings without cause and without prior approval of the chairman the board shall declare the members office vacant and the city council shall promptly fill such vacancy the members shall serve in accordance with ordinances of the city council and may be suspended and removed for cause as provided by law for the removal of members of boards c subsequent terms upon expiration of the initial terms all members may then be appointed to serve one additional threeyear term exh a 2707 qualifications of members all members of the building trades board must be residents of the city except for those members as provided in subsection 141017 qualifications of the individuals appointed to the board shall be as follows 1 construction contractor must meet the requirements of this article 2 master electrician must meet the requirements of this article 3 master plumber must meet the requirements of this article 4 mechanical contractor must meet the requirements of this article 5 the architect must be a registered architect under the laws of the state 6 the engineer must be a registered engineer under the laws of the state 7 the class a air conditioning contractor must meet the requirements of this article exh a 2707 manager the code administration manager as designated by the city manager shall be an ex officio nonvoting member of the building trades board and shall interpret the various trade codes adopted by the city for the benefit of the members of the board and public exh a 2707 powers and duties  meetings  required vote a the powers authority and duties of the building trades board are limited to the incorporated areas of the city b the board shall meet at least four times each year however upon request of the city or at such other times as may be necessary the chairman of the board may call a hearing of the board hearings may also be called by written notice signed by at least three members of the board or the board may set a schedule of hearings for a given year minutes shall be kept of all hearings of this board and all hearings and proceedings shall be open to the public c the board shall elect a chairman vicechairman and secretary at the january meeting to serve for the ensuing year the chairman may be elected to succeed himself the board shall keep minutes of its proceedings and records of its official actions d five members of the board shall constitute a quorum at any meeting and a majority vote of the board shall be required to enable the board to take disciplinary action against a contractor as provided in this article a majority vote of those board members present shall be required for all other official actions of the board e the board shall promulgate rules and regulations for the conduct of its meetings and hearings f the board shall have the duty of determining the eligibility of applicants to take required examinations upon which certificates of competency are based and to issue certificates of competency upon proper qualification of applicants g the board is authorized to enforce the applicable provisions of this article against registered contractors h the board is authorized to subpoena alleged violators and witnesses to its hearings subpoenas may be served by the department of public safety sheriffs office of the city i the board is authorized to subpoena evidence to its hearings j the board is authorized to take testimony under oath exh a 2707 removal of members the city council may remove any member of the building trades board for misconduct incompetency or neglect of duty  provided such member so accused shall be entitled to a hearing before the city council and at least ten days notice of hearing shall be given to the member exh a 2707 notice of noncompliance a upon receiving a written or oral complaint from a governmental agency or any city agency for reasonable cause to believe that a locally licensed or registered contractor has violated the duties and provisions of this article florida statutes or any adopted building code growth management services may initiate an investigation it is the policy of the city that the purpose of regulation is to protect the public by attaining compliance with the policies established in law fines and other penalties are provided in order to ensure compliance  however the collection of fines and the imposition of penalties are intended to be secondary to the primary goal of attaining compliance with this article it is the intent of the city council that growth management services charged with enforcing this article shall issue a notice of noncompliance as its first response to a minor violation of this article in any instance in which it is reasonable to assume that the violator was unaware of such a law or ordinance or unclear as to how to comply with it a violation of this article is a minor violation if it does not result in economic or physical harm to a person or adversely affect the public health safety or welfare or create a significant threat of such harm b a notice of noncompliance is a notification by growth management services which is issued to the locally licensed or registered contractor that is subject to article ix a notice of noncompliance should not be accompanied with a fine or other disciplinary penalty it should identify the specific ordinance that is being violated provide information on how to comply with this article and specify a reasonable time for the violator to comply with this article failure of said licensee to take action correcting the violation within a set period of time would then result in the institution of further disciplinary proceedings exh a 2707 administrative complaint a if the investigation determines that a violation of this article has occurred and there is sufficient evidence to prosecute growth management services shall file an administrative complaint with the board if an administrative complaint is filed the board shall hold a public hearing to determine if disciplinary action should be taken against the contractor and if so specify the action each administrative complaint shall provide as a minimum the following information 1 the name and address of the alleged violator being charged  2 a clear statement of the violations charged  3 a clear statement of the factual basis for the charges  and 4 a recommendation to the board for action to be taken against the local license or registration copies of contracts drawings or specifications may be attached as an exhibit to the complaint b upon the filing of an administrative complaint the alleged violator will be notified that the board will conduct a public hearing to investigate the allegations in the complaint by certified mail return receipt requested  by hand delivery by the sheriff or other law enforcement officer or code enforcement officerinvestigator or by leaving the notice at the violators usual place of residence with some person of his family above 18 years of age and informing such person of the contents of the notice or by publication in accordance with fs  120605 the alleged violator shall be given at least ten days written notice prior to the date of the public hearing said notice shall state the date time and place of said hearing and that the alleged violator is responsible for making hisher own arrangements for preserving the testimony given at the hearing c each contractor holding a license or registration from the city shall be responsible for keeping hisher current mailing address on file with the building official the building official shall be responsible for timely mailing delivering or publishing a notice of hearing to the contractor d the building official shall provide clerical and administrative personnel to the board as may reasonably be required e each case before the board shall be presented by the building official or other city staff at the hearing the board shall proceed to hear evidence and testimony on the cases before the board all testimony shall be under oath and shall be recorded the board shall take testimony from the building official or city staff the alleged violator and other witnesses called by either the city staff or the alleged violator formal rules of evidence shall not apply but fundamental due process shall be observed and shall govern the proceedings after hearing evidence andor testimony on the case the board shall issue its order findings of fact and conclusions of law and shall issue an order affording the proper relief consistent with the powers granted in this article the board building official or his duly authorized representative or the alleged violator may request a postponement or continuance of a scheduled public hearing f the board may take any of the following actions against any certificate holder or registrant require financial restitution to a consumer for financial harm directly related to a violation of a provision of this article or impose suspension or revocation of the registration or certificate of competency or impose an administrative fine not to exceed $500000 per violation or a combination thereof exh a 2707 orders imposing disciplinary action a orders imposing disciplinary action against a contractor shall contain at a minimum the following 1 a clear statement of the violations charged  2 a clear statement of the factual basis for the charges  3 evidence that the contractor was given notice of the charges and of an opportunity to appear and present evidence and testimony regarding the charges  4 findings of fact made by the board  5 conclusions of law which demonstrate that the facts alleged constitute violations of this article  6 a statement of the penalty and any reasonable investigative and legal costs imposed against the locally licensed or registered contractor  7 a recommendation by the board to the construction industry licensing board or the electrical contractors licensing board as the case may be for action to be taken against the state registration  8 a clear statement informing the contractor of the right to appeal the action against the license registration or certificate of competency and of the right of the contractor to challenge the recommendation to the construction industry licensing board or the electrical contractors licensing board as the case may be b the boards recommendation to the construction industry licensing board or the electrical contractors licensing board as the case may be for purposes of any challenge to said recommendation shall be considered to have been issued upon receipt by the board recommendations by the board and challenges shall be mailed to the construction industry licensing board or the electrical contractors licensing board as the case may be the board shall submit copies of the following documents to the construction industry licensing board or the electrical contractors licensing board as the case may be along with the following 1 the administrative complaint  2 minutes or a transcript of the hearing  3 any exhibits considered by the board  and 4 if a challenge is filed upon request of the construction industry licensing board electrical contractors licensing board or the department of business and professional regulation proof of service or if not perfected proof of attempts to obtain service exh a 2707 investigative and legal costs the board may assess reasonable investigative and legal costs for the prosecution of the violation against the violator for the purpose of this article reasonable investigative and legal costs shall include the cost of any consultation with an expert witness for the prosecution of the violation exh a 2707 penalties cumulative and consecutive where several of the above violations shall occur in one or several cases being considered together the penalties shall normally be cumulative and consecutive exh a 2707 exemptions the exemptions contained in fs   and  shall apply to this article exh a 2707 definitions the following words terms and phases when used in this article shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this article except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning board means the city building trades board building code means the building code of the city building maintenance engineer means a person who possesses the qualifications of a journeyman plumber and who is regularly employed to maintain or make necessary repairs to the plumbing fixtures installed contained and used in or upon buildings or premises owned or occupied or controlled by the person or firm by whom employed building official means the code administration manager of the city or his duly authorized representative certificate means a certificate of competency issued by the code administration manager as provided in this article construction contractor means any person who for compensation undertakes to or submits a bid to or does himself or by others construct repair alter remodel add to subtract from or improve any building or structure including related improvements to real estate for others or for resale to others and who is responsible for substantially the entire project construction contractors are subdivided into three classifications as follows 1 general contractor  whose scope of operation is unlimited as to the height and complexity of design in the construction he undertakes who has shown evidence of possessing the necessary knowledge and experience and has been granted a general contractors certificate of competency as provided in this article 2 building contractor  whose services are limited to construction of commercial buildings and single or multipledwelling residential buildings neither to exceed three stories in height and accessory use structures in connection therewith or those whose services are limited to remodeling repair or improvement of any size building if the services do not affect the structural members of the building 3 residential building contractor  whose services are limited to construction remodeling repair or improvement of one two or threefamily unit residences not exceeding two stories in height and accessory use structure in connection therewith contracting means except as exempted in this article engaging in business as a contractor city means the territory in the city within the corporate limits of the city of debary electrical code means the electrical code of the city electrical construction includes and governs all work and materials used in installing maintaining and extending a system of electrical wiring for light heat power or advertising and all appurtenances thereof or all apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith inside or attached to any building or structure lot or premises  provided however that none of the provisions of this article shall apply to the replacement of lamps or the connection of portable devises to suitable receptacles which have been permanently installed firm means any type of organization including copartnership corporation company association and individual h h block & associates examination used throughout this article shall mean experior journeyman electrician means a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to install electrical wiring apparatus or equipment for light heat power or advertising as covered in this article under the supervision of a licensed master electrician journeyman installer means a person who possesses the necessary qualified training and technical knowledge to install extend alter repair maintain or remove any mechanical apparatus or any device in connection therewith for air conditioning heating ventilation refrigeration and incinerator and who is qualified under the terms and provisions of this article and shall have capacity of doing mechanical work under the supervision of a mechanical contractor according to the plans and specifications furnished to him in accordance with the rules and regulations governing mechanical installations within the limits of this article or the mechanical code journeyman plumber means a person who performs the manual work of installing plumbing under the direction of a master plumber andor plumbing contractor license means the occupational license issued by the county as a prerequisite of engaging in business master electrician means a person who possesses the necessary qualifications training and technical knowledge to plan lay out and supervise the installation of electrical wiring apparatus or equipment for light heat power or advertising as covered by the terms and provisions of this article master plumber and plumbing contractor means a person who assumes responsible charge and direction or other persons in the installation of plumbing mechanical code means the mechanical code of the city mechanical contractor there shall be five classes of mechanical contractors as follows 1 mechanical contractor means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill to install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is preformed by the contractor as is necessary to make complete an air distribution system boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems lift station equipment and piping and all appurtenances apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith and to install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law piping insulation of pipes vessels and ducts pressure and process piping pneumatic control piping gasoline tanks and pump installations and piping for same standpipe airlines vacuum line piping oxygen lines nitrous oxide piping ink and chemical lines fuel transmission lines and installation of a condensate drain from an air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system the scope of the work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings potable water lines or connections thereto sanitary sewer lines swimming pool piping and filters or electrical power wiring 2 class a air conditioning contractor means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill to install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor as is necessary to make complete an air distribution system boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems and all apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith and to install maintain repair fabricate alter or design when not prohibited by law piping pneumatic control piping and installation of a condensate drain from an air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or any other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system the scope of the work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings potable water lines or connections thereto sanitary sewer lines swimming pool piping and filters or electrical power wiring 3 class b air conditioning contractor means any person whose services are limited to 25 tons cooling and 500000 btu heating in any one system in the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill to install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law central air conditioning refrigeration heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor as is necessary to make complete an air distribution system being installed under this classification and to install maintain repair fabricate alter extend or design when not prohibited by law piping insulating of pipes vessels and ducts and installation of condensate drain from an air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system 4 class c air conditioning contractor means any person whose business is limited to the servicing of air conditioning heating or refrigeration systems including duct alterations in connection with those systems he is servicing 5 class d sheet metal contractor means a contractor whose services are unlimited in the sheet metal trade and who has the experience knowledge and skill necessary for the manufacture assembling handling erection installation dismantling conditioning adjustment alteration repair servicing or designing when not prohibited by law of ferrous or nonferrous metal work of us no 10 gauge or its equivalent or lighter gauge and of other materials used in lieu thereof and of air handling equipment and reinforcement of same and including the balancing of airhandling systems owneroccupier means a person having a vested interest in the property who either occupies or intends to occupy the premises and who improves the premises for his own use plumbing means the practice materials and fixtures used in the installation maintenance extension and alteration of all piping fixtures appliances and appurtenances in connection with any of the following sanitary drainage or storm drainage facilities the venting system and the public or private water supply systems within or adjacent to any building structure or conveyance  also the practice and materials used in the installation maintenance extension or alteration of stormwater liquid waste or sewage and water supply systems of any premises to their connection with any point of public disposal or other acceptable terminal plumbing does not include the installation alteration repair or maintenance of automatic sprinklers and their related appurtenances plumbing code means the plumbing code of the city residential solar water heating contractor means a specialty contractor whose contracting business consists of the execution of contracts requiring the skill knowledge ability and experience to size install alter repair maintain relocate replace or use residential domestic potable solar water heating systems to include solar heating panels and all appurtenances apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith the scope of work of a residential solar water heating contractor is limited to solar domestic hot water systems for onefamily twofamily or threefamily residences not exceeding two stories in height and solar swimming pool heaters for residential swimming pools the connection to potable water supplies is limited to statecertified residential solar water heating contractors nothing in this article shall be deemed to restrict or limit in any manner the legal authority of dulylicensed mechanical contractors class a and b air conditioning contractors or plumbing contractors to install residential solar water heating systems responsible managing employee or official means any agent officer or employee of a construction contractor electrical contractor mechanical contractor andor plumbing contractor who has authority to make administrative decisions to hire promote transfer lay off disciple or discharge other employees or effectively to recommend such action or to superintend work in progress and who is available for consultation in the technical and administrative phases of his principals business when there is no work in progress specialty structure contractor means a contractor whose services are limited to the execution of contracts requiring the experience knowledge and skill necessary for the fabrication assembling handling erection installation dismantling adjustment alteration repair servicing and design work when not prohibited by law in accordance with accepted engineering data andor according to manufacturers specifications in the aluminum metal vinyl and fiberglass screening material construction trade 1 the scope of work of a specialty structure contractor shall include and be limited to screened porches screened enclosures pool enclosure performed panelpost and beam roofs mobile home panel roofovers residential glass window enclosures vinyl panel window enclosures singlestory selfcontained aluminum utility storage structure not to exceed 500 square feet siding soffit fascia and gutters all work shall comply with all plans specifications codes laws and regulations applicable 2 the scope of such work shall include masonry concrete work and be limited to foundations slab and block kneewalls incidental to the aluminum and allied materials construction work the specialty structure contractor whose services are limited shall not perform any work that alters the structural integrity of the building including but not limited to roof trusses lintels load bearing walls and foundations 3 the specialty structure contractor shall subcontract with a licensed qualified contractor in the field concerned all other work incidental to that which is defined in this section but which is the work of a trade other than that of a specialty structure contractor nothing in this article shall be constructed to limit or infringe upon the scope of work of any specialty structure contractor certified pursuant to fs  3 and 6 exh a 2707 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 secs 1412414130  reserved article v  miscellaneous provisions purpose  certification by state a the purpose of this article is to 1 set forth the qualifications for a person or firm other than state certified contractors to engage in the business as a construction contractor electrical contractor mechanical contractor andor plumbing contractor as defined in this article within the incorporated areas of the city 2 require the state certification of residential solar water heating contractors to perform work within the city pursuant to fs ch 489 and rule 21e1512 florida administrative solar water heating contractors who as of the effective date of the ordinance from which this article derives have a 198889 county occupational license for this trade and are registered with the state may continue to engage in the trade without becoming state certified  except that only state certified residential solar water heating contractors are qualified to connect to a potable water supply 3 require the state certification of specialty structure contractors to perform work within the city pursuant to fs ch 489 and rule 21e florida administrative structure contractors who as of the effective date of the ordinance have a 198889 county occupational license for this trade and are registered with the state may continue to engage in the trade without becoming state certified if the contractor should have his occupational license or state registration suspended or revoked or should the holder fail to renew then the contractor must become state certified to engage in the occupation b the board will no longer issue new certificates of competency  all construction contractors mechanical contractors andor plumbing contractors wishing to engage in the business of construction contracting mechanical contracting andor plumbing contracting must be certified by the state pursuant to fs ch 489 or its successor with the following exceptions 1 construction contractors mechanical contractors andor plumbing contractors who as of  have a current county certificate of competency for 198182 and are registered with the state and have a current county occupational license for 198182 may continue to engage in the construction contracting classification for which they are certified upon making application for renewal pursuant to section 14122 2 as of  construction contractors mechanical contractors andor plumbing contractors who have active and valid certificates of competency from cities outside the county or counties other than volusia county who are state registered and who meet the requirements of reciprocity may be granted an initial certificate of competency until  c all roofing contractors and swimming pool contractors as defined by fs ch 489 operating within the city must hereafter be certified by the state before conducting their trade d any person who desires to become a statecertified residential solar water heating contractor or state certified specialty structure contractor shall apply to the construction industry licensing board of the state department of professional regulation in writing to take and pass the certification examination a person shall be entitled to take the certification examination if the person 1 is 18 years of age  2 is of good moral character  and 3 meets eligibility requirements according to one of the criteria established in fs  2c1 2c2 or 2c3 e if the contractor should have his occupational license or state registration suspended or revoked or should the holder fail to renew then the contractors must become state certified to engage in the occupation exh a 2707 issuance of occupational license  qualifications  fee a before an occupational license shall be granted to a construction contractor electrical contractor mechanical contractor andor a plumbing contractor by the county he shall be required to produce the following 1 a certificate of competency as issued by the code administration manager or certification by the state 2 a certificate signed by a qualified agent of a casualty or liability company or other proof of compliance with the workers compensation law b revocation or suspension of a previouslyissued certificate of competency shall immediately nullify the occupational license granted under this article c the occupational license fee to be paid to the county shall be in the amount fixed by resolution of the county council after due public notice and hearing thereof d roofing contractors and swimming pool contractors who have been issued a county occupational license for the fiscal year 19791980 and who are registered by the state pursuant to fs ch 489 may continue to pursue their trade for as long as they maintain their state registration any loss of the state registration by whatever means shall require the contractor to become state certified if he wished to continue the pursuit of his trade exh a 2707 exemptions from licensing requirements a private residences an owneroccupier may secure a building permit for and perform and supervise work in connection with construction of his own private residence for his own occupancy or the maintenance of addition to alteration of or repair of his own private residence  provided that the work to be done shall conform with the building code electrical code mechanical code plumbing code and other ordinance as pertaining to building and construction within the city  and provide further that no owneroccupier shall be permitted to construct more than one home per calendar year unless he shall be licensed as a construction contractor as defined in this article the construction of more than one residence by an individual owner in any 12month period shall be constructed as construction contracting nothing contained in this section shall prohibit an owneroccupier from obtaining a building permit for the maintenance repair or addition to his own existing residential property more than one time during any calendar year b commercial buildings the owner of a commercial building may make alteration andor repairs to such building without being licensed as required in this article provided that no structural changes are involved which would require an expert knowledge of construction in the interest of the public safety  provided further that such alterations andor repairs meet each and every requirement of the building code and other ordinances pertaining to building construction within the city and provided such alteration andor repair does not exceed $500000 each exh a 2707 appeals if any person feels aggrieved at a decision of the board or of the building official in refusing to grant such person the right to take an examination or grant a license building permit or certificate of competency under this article such person may appeal to the city council within ten days of such decision the city council shall have the sole authority to act on the appeal any decision of the building official pertaining to this article may be appealed to the construction board of adjustments and appeals pursuant to the standard building exh a 2707 disciplinary proceedings the following acts shall constitute grounds for disciplinary action 1 attempting to procure or obtaining a certificate of competency or registration to practice a trade by fraud bribery or fraudulent or willful misrepresentation 2 being convicted or found guilty of or entering a plea of nolo contendere to regardless of adjudication a crime in any jurisdiction which directly relates to the practice of contracting or the ability to practice contracting 3 making or filing a report or record which the certificate holder or registrant knows to be false willfully failing to file a report or record required by state county or federal law willfully impeding or obstructing such filing or inducing anther person to impede or obstruct such filing such reports or records shall include only those which are signed in the capacity of a certified contractor 4 violating fs ch 633 or the rules of the state fire marshal 5 practicing on a revoked suspended inactive or delinquent certificate of competency or registration 6 willfully or deliberately disregarding and violating the applicable building codes or laws of the state or county thereof 7 performing any act which assists a person or entity in engaging in the prohibited unregistered practice of contracting if the certificate holder or registrant knows or has reasonable grounds to know that the person or entity was unregistered 8 knowingly combining or conspiring with an unregistered person by allowing his or her certificate of competency or registration to be used by the unregistered person with intent to evade the provisions of this article when a certificate holder or registrant allows his or her certificate or registration to be used by one or more business organizations without having any active participation in the operations management or control of such business organizations such act constitutes prima facie evidence of an intent to evade the provisions of this article 9 acting in the capacity of a contractor under any certificate of competency or registration issued hereunder except in the name of the certificate holder or registrant as set forth on the issued certificate of competency or registration or in accordance with the personnel of the certificate holder or registrant as set forth in the application for the certificate of competency or registration or as later changed as provided in this article 10 committing mismanagement or misconduct in the practice of contracting that causes financial harm to a customer financial mismanagement or misconduct occurs when a valid liens have been recorded against the property or a contractors customer for supplies or services ordered by the contractor for the customers job  the contractor has received funds from the customer to pay for the supplies or services  and the contractor has not had the liens removed from the property by payment or by bond within 75 days after the date of such liens  b the contractor has abandoned a customers job and the percentage of completion is less than the percentage of the total contract price paid to the contractor as of the time of abandonment unless the contractor is entitled to retain such funds under the
