this article shall not be applied to persons residing at a prohibited location on the effective date of this article such that it is not the intent of this article to impair valid existing and bona fide contract rights  provided however that the provisions of this article shall apply upon termination of any leasehold relationship arising from a landlord tenant relationship or the expiration of a lease when a person who is the subject of this article changes residences this article shall fully apply to such persons  9605 solid waste footnotes  1  cross reference  et seq  hazardous materials cost recovery for accidental spills  30191 et seq state law reference florida litter law fs    resource recovery and management fs   et seq article i  in general theft or vandalism of recycling containers or recyclable materials a definitions for the purpose of this section the following terms shall have the meaning indicated in this subsection 1 recycling containers means the receptacles purchased leased and distributed or placed by or on behalf of the city to city residents or locations for the intended use as a receptacle of recyclable materials 2 recyclable materials means those materials which are capable of being recycled and which would otherwise be processed or disposed of as solid waste including newspaper glass and plastic containers aluminum cans and such other materials as designated by resolution of the city council b ownership of recyclable materials all recyclable materials once placed at a collection location or in a recycling container at a collection location become the exclusive property of the city recovery of recyclable materials from any solid waste generated or brought within the city must occur prior to the placing in a recyclable container at a collection location and such recovery shall be subject to state and local public health and safety laws c prohibited acts no person shall be permitted to collect vandalize or remove either recycling containers or recyclable materials placed in or near the recycling containers or designated collection locations unless previously authorized by the city d penalty violations of this section are punishable as provided in section 115 secs 3823830  reserved article ii  collection and disposal from nonresidential premises division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning authorized collector means any person or party who is franchised to collect and transport solid waste in the city building permit means a permit which allows construction andor demolition on real property bulk trash means large cuttings of vegetative and wood matter which are part of normal yard maintenance which shall be placed in a commercial refuse bin bulk trash may include for commercial purposes matter or debris resulting from tree removal land clearing land development building demolition or home improvement home improvements would include but not be limited to carpeting cabinets drywall lumber paneling and other such constructionrelated materials bulk trash does not include automobiles and automotive components boats and internal combustion engines in the case of a dispute between a collector and a customer as to what constitutes bulk trash the situation will be reviewed and decided by the director whose decision will be final commercial collection service means the solid waste collection and transportation service provided to commercial property as defined in this section commercial property shall consist of but not be limited to improved real property utilized for wholesale or retail sales motels hotels mobile home or recreational vehicle parks bowling alleys theaters stores offices apartments and condominiums not meeting the definition of multifamily dwelling unit restaurants service stations and garages laundries and other cleaning establishments manufacturing industrial agricultural and institutional establishments and residential improved real property which is ten acres or more in area and any property where construction or demolition is proceeding for purposes of this article the zoning of the property whether the business is licensed or not or whether the activity is for profit or not shall not affect its designation as commercial commercial refuse bin means a large container made of nonabsorbent material typically metal for commercial solid waste or recyclable material usually of the twocubicyard to eightcubicyard size and rolloff containers of larger capacities which are emptied into collection vehicles by mechanical means construction and demolition debris means materials generally considered not to be water soluble and nonhazardous in nature including but not limited to steel glass brick concrete or asphalt roofing material pipe gypsum wallboard and lumber from the construction or destruction of a structure as part of a construction or demolition project and including rocks soils tree remains trees and other vegetative matter which normally result from land clearing or land development operations for a construction project container means a container made of nonabsorbent material provided with a closely fitting cover and side bail handles and of 30 gallons or less gross capacity the container shall not weigh more than 60 pounds when loaded the director may approve alternative containers customer means all persons occupying commercial property within the city except those persons granted exemptions director means that person designated by the city council by interlocal agreement or appointment disposal area means any site location tract of land area building or premises used for solid waste accumulation or disposal which has been permitted by the state department of environmental protection franchise means a nonexclusive grant awarded by the city council to a collector to provide collection andor transportation service to commercial property within the city garbage means all putrescible animal and vegetable waste resulting from growing processing marketing and preparation of food items including containers in which packaged garden trash means all accumulations of leaves grass or shrubbery cuttings and other refuse attendant to the care of lawns shrubbery vines trees and tree limbs garden trash shall be placed in containers or bundled such term does not include those items defined as bulk trash hazardous waste means waste or a combination of waste and other discarded material including solid liquid semisolid or contained gaseous material which because of its quantity concentration or physical chemical or infectious characteristics may cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality or an increase in serious irreversible or incapacitating reversible illness or may pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment when improperly treated stored transported disposed of or otherwise managed such terms shall include any substance determined to be a hazardous waste by the united states environmental protection agency or the state department of environmental protection industrial waste means any solid waste accumulations of metal metal products minerals chemicals rock cement asphalt tar oil grease glass crockery rubber tires bottles cans lumber sawdust waste from animal packing or slaughterhouses or other materials usually created by an industrial enterprise infectious wastes means those wastes which may cause disease or reasonably be suspected of harboring pathogenic organisms included are wastes resulting from the operation of medical clinics hospitals and other facilities producing wastes which may consist of but are not limited to diseased human and animal parts contaminated bandages pathological specimens hypodermic needles contaminated clothing and surgical gloves junk means any tangible item such as furniture appliances bicycles excluding motor vehicles or similar property not having a useful purpose to the owner or abandoned by the owner and not included within the definition of the term garbage garden trash or rubbish maximum allowable collection rate means the maximum rate established by the city council which collectors may charge their customers for commercial collection service except for rolloff containers multifamily dwelling unit means any building or structure containing four or less dwelling units held under common ownership and either under common roof or having common walls or a cooperative agreement for provision of services occupational license means a license granting the privilege of engaging in any business profession or occupation at a particular location occupational waste means solid waste generated on the job by nonstationary businesses eg lawn services contractors and roofers packer truck means a vehicle equipped with a packer unit hydraulically operated for loading and unloading of solid waste parkway means that portion of the street rightofway paralleling any public thoroughfare between the curbline or paving line and the abutting property line refuse means a combination of or mixture of garbage trash rubbish or any other solid waste materials rubbish means refuse accumulation of paper excelsior rags wooden or paper boxes or containers sweepings and all other accumulations of any nature other than garbage which are usual to housekeeping and to the operation of stores offices and other business places and also any bottles cans or other containers which due to their ability to retain water may serve as breeding places for mosquitoes or other waterbreeding insects solid waste is a general term that includes the specific terms garbage garden trash junk rubbish refuse construction and demolition debris and bulk trash special waste means any waste that requires special handling due to regulatory requirement or physical properties as determined by the director street means an open public rightofway or dedicated rightofway with passable access transportation license means a license issued for a period of one year which allows persons to transport solid waste including occupational waste by the generator of such occupational waste provided that the person owns and operates an approved vehicle for the collection and transportation of the solid waste truck means any truck trailer conveyance equipment or vehicle used to collect andor transport solid waste upon or along a public highway approved by the director i 32394 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 penalty violations of this article are punishable as provided in section 115 i 32394 authority under the authority of fs   this article is hereby enacted i 32394 state law reference local government solid waste management responsibilities fs   purpose and intent a the purpose of this article is to ensure that all solid waste generated and accumulated within the city shall be collected removed and disposed of by an authorized collector except as otherwise provided in this article in a proper sanitary and efficient manner to eliminate illegal dumping within the city and to promote the general health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city b it is the intent of the city that collection and transporting of solid waste is to be done only by those authorized by the city and that disposal shall be done only at a citydesignated solid waste disposal area i 32394 prima facie evidence of accumulation of waste the fact that any real property is improved and located within the city shall be prima facie evidence that solid waste is being generated or accumulated upon such property and that the property is thus subject to the provisions of this article i 32394 enforcement compliance with the requirements of this article shall be regulated issuance of occupational licenses building permits tipping fee receipts and spot checks proof of compliance with this article must be demonstrated before licenses or permits are issued or renewed i 32394 duties of owners and occupants of commercial property  containers a proper disposal of waste required it shall be the responsibility of all ownersoccupants of commercial property to dispose of their solid waste in a manner which would not be detrimental to the public health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city b use of collection service all ownersoccupants of commercial property are mandated to subscribe to solid waste commercial collection service with a collector franchised by the city unless authorized to do otherwise pursuant to this article at a rate agreed upon by the parties but not to exceed the maximum allowable collection rate it shall be a violation of this article to dispose of solid waste except as provided in this article c provision and maintenance of containers it shall be the responsibility of the ownersoccupants of commercial property to provide approved containers or refuse bins adequate to contain all solid waste generated from the commercial property the commercial refuse bin may be leased from the franchised collector the owneroccupant shall maintain the containers or refuse bins and the area of their location in a clean and sanitary condition spillage from overfilled containers or refuse bins will not be picked up by the collector d unacceptable containers any privately owned container or refuse bin which is in disrepair due to the lack of a wellfitting cover or the presence of holes cracks or tears in the bottom or sides may be condemned and so marked by the collector any container so marked must be immediately replaced by the owneroccupant with acceptable containers as specified in this article e obstruction of containers customers shall not permit persons objects obstructions or vehicles to hinder in any way whatsoever the servicing of the container or refuse bin by the authorized collectors vehicles and personnel f placement of containers  enclosure  base all commercial refuse bins except approved recycling containers shall be enclosed on at least three sides with a sixfoothigh screen the screen shall consist of a wood or cyclone slat fence or masonry wall or other approved screening material the bin shall be enclosed in such a manner that said bin will be screened from public streets and adjoining properties a concrete or asphalt pad or other approved material shall be provided as a base for the bin the pad shall be at the approximate level of the service vehicle approach area so that the truck loading mechanism can align with the containers sleeves the screened enclosure area or container shall not be located within any street rightofway i 32394 exemptions a criteria exemptions from the requirement for solid waste collection for ownersoccupants of commercial property shall be granted as follows 1 exemptions shall be granted by the director only on individual parcels that contain one individual commercial establishment and where a the owneroccupant can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the director that the solid waste generated on the property is being disposed of on the property in conformance with all applicable rules and regulations  or b the owneroccupant collects and transports the solid waste generated on the property provided that 1 the solid waste is disposed of at a designated solid waste disposal area  2 the vehicles utilized are leased or owned solely by the owneroccupant  3 the personnel utilized are employed solely by the owneroccupant  and 4 the owneroccupant has obtained a transportation license from the director in accordance with the provisions of this article 2 an exemption may be granted where the property is receiving residential service pursuant to article iii of this chapter 3 no individual exemption shall be granted by the director until an application has been made in accordance with the provisions in this section 4 no individual exemption shall be granted by the director which may result in the degradation of the environment or create unsightly conditions 5 all individual exemptions granted by the director shall be for one year and may be withdrawn by the director if the conditions under which it was granted have changed 6 any person receiving an individual exemption shall not collect and remove solid waste generated on his property except in the manner proposed in the application for the individual exemption b procedure the owneroccupant of any parcel of commercial property desiring an individual exemption may make application for such individual exemption to the director the application shall be made on forms provided by the director and shall provide at a minimum the following information 1 the name of the applicant  2 the legal description of the property for which the individual exemption is sought  3 the reason the individual exemption is sought  4 the proposed method of collection removal and where applicable disposal of solid waste if the individual exemption is granted  and 5 the ability to meet the requirements of subsection a1b of this section if applicable c revocation if the director determines that solid waste is not being collected and disposed of in a proper sanitary and effective manner from any improved real property for which an individual exemption has been issued he shall revoke the individual exemption i 32394 frequency of collection the frequency type nature and cost of the commercial collection service shall be established individually between the commercial property owneroccupant and the collector within the provisions of this article but the frequency shall not be less than once a week i 32394 remote commercial units if remote or isolated commercial properties are unable to attract commercial service the owneroccupant may contract with the residential collector who has been granted an exclusive residential franchise for that area the price shall not exceed the maximum allowable commercial rate in the alternative the city shall establish a list of all franchised commercial collectors who shall provide annual refuse service to the various isolated commercial properties the collectors shall be rotated annually i 32394 prohibited acts a it shall be unlawful and an offense against the city for any unauthorized person to do any of the following 1 to place or cause to be placed any solid waste upon the property of another 2 to convey or cause to be conveyed over and upon any of the streets highways and alleys of the city any solid waste without a franchise or license or both such franchise and license unless exempt as may be required by this article 3 to deposit or dispose of any solid waste in or upon any public street sidewalk rightofway or alleyway or any stream ditch river pond creek park or public place in the city except in authorized containers 4 to burn any solid waste generated or brought within the city unless all applicable permits have been obtained 5 to place solid waste out for collection in any location not serviced by the collector 6 to remove solid waste from any refuse bin or container from a collection location or from curbside 7 to accumulate or cause to be accumulated any solid waste in or upon any premises or lot owned by him or in his control for an unreasonable period of time without providing for legal disposal 8 to place out for collection any hazardous or infectious waste as defined in this article such waste shall be disposed of according to applicable law b the city incorporates the provisions of fs   the florida litter law as part of this article and violations of said law may be subject to the enforcement provisions of this article i 32394 secs 38423860  reserved division 2  private collection services footnotes  2  cross reference businesses ch 26 franchises a generally the city council may enter into franchise agreements with one or more persons to provide for commercial collection service within specified areas or the whole city applicants for franchises shall apply on forms and upon conditions required by the city franchises may only be granted after a duly noticed public hearing after considering the application and upon a resolution of the city council b franchises not exclusive  term  cancellation all franchises shall be nonexclusive and be for a term not to exceed five years such franchises may be cancelled by either party without cause upon one years written notice c fee each franchise holder shall pay to the city five percent of its gross revenues received from commercial collections within the city this fee shall be paid monthly within 15 days of the end of the month this fee shall go to help recover the costs associated with implementing and administering the mandatory commercial solid waste collection program and provide funds to facilitate the implementation of the solid waste management act of 1988 d failure to operate failure to operate for a period of 30 consecutive days shall be grounds for automatic cancellation of the franchise e transfer franchises shall not be transferred without approval of the city council i 32394 establishment of rates a the city council shall hold a public hearing when needed to adopt a commercial rate schedule to include maximum allowable collection rates under this division such rate schedule may include 1 the maximum commercial collection service charge per uncompacted cubic yard of refuse bin 2 the franchise fee including amount and conditions of payment 3 the transportation license fee b the city shall not grant an increase in the maximum allowable collection rate unless the financial statements required are submitted in a timely manner to the director the director shall determine the financial statements required c the city shall not establish rates for rolloff containers or compacted refuse i 32394 state law reference local solid waste management fees fs   performance and operation standards  insurance  complaints a performance standards 1 vehicles and equipment generally collectors subject to this division shall use only vehicles commonly referred to as packer trucks or rolloff vehicles unless otherwise approved by the director equipped with bodies which are watertight to a depth of not less than 12 inches solid metal sides and pneumatic tires collectors shall provide sufficient equipment to maintain regular schedules of collection and to promptly and efficiently perform their duties 2 vehicle covers each vehicle used for the collection of solid waste shall have a fully enclosed metal top the director shall have the authority to waive the requirement of a fully enclosed top as an alternative to a fully enclosed metal top said vehicle may be equipped with a cover which may be a net with mesh not greater than 1 inches or a tarpaulin  and such cover shall be kept in good mechanical order and used to cover the load in traveling to from and during the loading operation and if the contents are likely to be scattered when parked 3 maintenance of equipment  identification on equipment equipment is to be maintained in a safe working condition and shall be painted uniformly according to standards maintained from time to time by the director equipment shall display the name telephone number and vehicle number of the collector 4 cleanup of scattered waste vehicles shall not be overloaded so as to scatter solid waste  but when solid waste is scattered from a collectors vehicle for any reason it shall be the responsibility of the collector to immediately pick up such scattered solid waste collectors shall not be responsible for cleaning up unsanitary conditions around the solid waste containers and refuse bins caused by carelessness of the customer 5 washing and sanitizing of vehicles vehicles are to be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be washed thoroughly on the inside and sanitized with a suitable disinfectant and deodorant at such times as established by the director all vehicles are to be washed on the outside at least weekly 6 vehicles not to be left unattended  interference with traffic collector vehicles shall not interfere unduly with vehicular or pedestrian traffic and shall not be left unattended while in operation 7 authority of director the director shall decide any and all questions which may arise concerning the quality and acceptability of the work and services performed by collectors the manner of performance the rate of progress of said work and the interpretation of the provisions of the franchise collectors shall have the right to appeal any decisions or findings of the director to the city council whose findings and conclusions shall be final and binding 8 cooperation with director collectors shall furnish the director with every reasonable opportunity for ascertaining whether or not the duties of the collector are being performed in accordance with the terms of the solid waste franchise collectors shall designate in writing the person to serve as agent between his organization and the city 9 collectors shall make collections with a minimum of noise and disturbance to the occupants of the building and surrounding neighborhoods and shall not collect from commercial or industrial collection points prior to the hour of  am or after  pm containers shall be handled carefully by the collectors and shall be thoroughly emptied and returned to their original locations b operation standards 1 supervision of operations  personnel collectors shall direct and supervise competent and qualified personnel and shall devote time and attention to the direction of the operation to ensure performance of obligations and duties as set forth in this article 2 office  office hours collectors shall provide at their own expense a suitable office located within the city and shall maintain office hours from  am to  pm each weekday in addition collectors shall designate a representative for emergency calls during the hours of  pm friday am monday 3 collectors not to be considered employees or agents of city collectors shall perform their duties under the terms and conditions of the solid waste collection franchise as an independent contractor and it shall not be construed or interpreted by virtue of such franchise that collectors or their employees are employees agents or representatives of the city 4 special contracts the city may contract with other parties to collect and dispose of all or a portion of excessive amounts of trash debris or refuse which has accumulated by reason of any hurricane tropical storm freeze natural disaster severe disturbance riot or other calamity 5 accounts collectors shall keep such uniform books and accounts as agreed upon by the city it shall be the responsibility of collectors to maintain said books and records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles the city shall have the right to audit such books and accounts at any time during normal business hours upon giving reasonable notice to collectors as to the time and place of such audit each collector shall maintain separate financial books and records of the operating costs and capital expenses pertaining to the performance of his duties under the solid waste franchise the collector shall submit any financial statements required by the director 6 annual audit collectors shall provide annually no later than july 31 at their own expense a certified audit performed by an independent certified public accountant such audit shall be performed in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards and shall cover the annual period ending not more than 180 days prior to july 31 and shall identify and separate that portion of the collectors business performed in their service areas financial statements required shall include a balance sheet income statement statement of changes in financial position and other schedules as may be required collectors shall also make available to the city the work papers of the auditor in connection with the certified audit collectors shall be advised not to contract for audit services with auditors who will not make work papers available to the city failure of collectors to provide these audits timely may result in a fine of $10000 per day for each day the audit is received after july 31 if the certified audit is not received within the prescribed time the director shall notify the collector in writing if the audit is not received within 30 days of such notice the city may conduct its own audit in such event in addition to the late fee set forth in this subsection the collector shall be liable to the city for all costs including court costs and reasonable attorneys fees incurred as the result of delinquent audits upon request received no later than july 15 of a given year the collector may obtain an extension not to exceed 30 days for good cause c insurance 1 workers compensation insurance collectors shall provide and maintain workers compensation insurance as required by law for all employees performing under a solid waste franchise collectors shall not subcontract unless subcontractors provide workers compensation insurance as required by law 2 indemnification collectors shall indemnify and hold harmless the city from any and all liability claims damages losses expenses proceedings and causes of action of every kind and nature arising out of or connected with the performance of their duties under a solid waste franchise 3 public liability insurance collectors shall provide and maintain at all times without cost or expense to the city policies of insurance generally known as public liability policies insuring the collector against any and all claims demands or causes of action whatsoever for injuries received or damage to property relating to the performance of the duties of the collector under the terms and provisions of a solid waste franchise such policies of insurance shall insure the collector in an amount not less than $30000000 to cover any and all claims connected with any accident or occurrence that may arise or be claimed to have arisen against the collector coverage shall include comprehensive general liability and vehicular liability the collector shall also obtain property damage insurance insuring the collector in an amount not less than $5000000 to cover the claims of any persons from a single or specific act that results in alleged damage to property the insurance policies shall provide that the city shall be entitled to 30 days written notice of any changes or cancellations of such policies 4 certificate of insurance a certificate of insurance indicating that the collector has coverage in accordance with the requirements set forth in this section shall be furnished by the collector to the director within ten days from the execution of a solid waste franchise d complaints when received collectors shall record complaints on a form approved by the director and shall take appropriate steps to resolve the complaint within 24 hours after its receipt if a complaint cannot be resolved within that time period the collector shall notify the director on the approved forms of action taken to resolve the complaint collectors shall provide the director with a full written explanation of the disposition of any customers complaint involving a claim of damage by a collectors employees or agents e termination of franchise the director shall notify in writing the collector of deficiencies or default in the performance of his duties under the franchise  and the collector shall have 15 days to correct same or to request in writing a hearing the city council shall hear and act upon same within 60 days from receipt of such request and shall notify the collector of such action the action by the city council shall be to confirm in whole or in part the specified deficiencies or default  or to relieve the collector of responsibilities for such deficiencies or default  or find that there are no deficiencies or default  or to take such action as deemed necessary in the judgment of the city council failure of the collector to remedy such specified items of deficiency or default in the notice by either the director or by the decision of the city council whichever is applicable within 15 days of receipt of such notice of such decisions shall result in the termination of the franchise in such an event the collector shall have the right to seek a judicial review of such action within 30 days of same i 32394   4208 transportation license a required  exceptions  fee no person may transport commercial solid waste within the unincorporated area without possessing a franchise or first obtaining a transportation license from the director this provision applies to all persons except authorized collectors and collectors for municipalities those persons utilizing their personal passenger cars station wagons or pickup trucks of threequarterton or less capacity to transport waste from property occupied by them to a solid waste disposal area designated by the director shall obtain a license at no cost all persons operating other trucks vehicles and trailers shall be required to obtain a license at the cost set by the city council b businesses generating occupational waste certain persons who own businesses for which the transportation of certain occupational waste is an integral part of the performance of that occupation shall obtain a license to transport these wastes to the disposal area designated by the director examples of such occupations include but are not limited to building roofing demolition and landclearing contractors  lawn care services  and tree surgeons c application each such person shall make application for a license to the director on forms containing 1 the name and address of the person  2 a description of the occupation  3 a description of the solid waste the occupation produces  4 a description of the equipment to be utilized  and 5 an agreement to comply with all conditions of the license and provisions of this article d term the length of term for a license to transport solid waste shall not exceed one year e revocation the director may revoke a license at any time if the person holding such license is in violation of the provisions of this article or the conditions of the license i 32394 free service unless authorized by the city council there shall be no free services rendered for the collection transportation or disposal of solid waste i 32394 secs 38663890  reserved article iii  collection and disposal from residential premises division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning bulk trash means large cuttings of vegetative and wood matter which are part of normal yard maintenance which cannot be cut for placement in a container or bundle due to the material exceeding the weight and size restrictions for regular yard trash bulk trash shall be of a type as to be readily handled by the mechanical equipment of the collector bulk material shall not exceed four feet in length or 60 pounds in weight bulk trash does not include any form of matter or debris resulting from tree removal land clearing land development building demolition or home improvement for purposes of this subsection home improvement materials include but are not limited to carpeting cabinets drywall lumber paneling and other such constructionrelated materials carpeting will be picked up by the collector if cut to lengths of six feet or less and bundled bulk trash does not include automobiles and automotive components boats and internal combustion engines in the case of a dispute between a collector and a customer as to what constitutes bulk trash the situation will be reviewed and decided by the director whose decision will be final collector means any person or party who is franchised to engage in collection or transportation of solid waste in the city container means a container made of nonabsorbent material provided with a closely fitting cover and side bail handles and of 30 gallons or less gross capacity the container shall not weigh more than 60 pounds when loaded the director may approve alternative containers customer means all persons owning residential improved real property within the district that is within the collectors service area except for persons granted exemptions director means the director of the solid waste management division of the county department of public works or designees disposal area means any site location tract of land area building or premises used for solid waste accumulation or disposal which has been permitted by the state department of environmental protection district means the boundaries of the volusia county mandatory solid waste collection and disposal special assessment district created under the authority of chapter 110 article iv franchise means a franchise granted by the city council to a collector to provide collection andor transportation service in city garbage means all putrescible animal and vegetable waste resulting from growing processing marketing and preparation of food items including containers in which packaged garden trash means all accumulations of leaves grass or shrubbery cuttings and other refuse attendant to the care of lawns shrubbery vines trees and tree limbs garden trash shall be placed in containers or bundled such term does not include those items defined as bulk trash hazardous waste means waste or a combination of waste and other discarded material including solid liquid semisolid or contained gaseous material which because of its quantity concentration or physical chemical or infectious characteristics may cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality or an increase in serious irreversible or incapacitating reversible illness or may pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment when improperly treated stored transported disposed of or otherwise managed such term shall include any substance determined to be a hazardous waste by the united states environmental protection agency or the state department of environmental protection improved property means all residential improved real property as defined in this section that generates or is capable of generating solid waste industrial waste means any solid waste accumulations of metal metal products minerals chemicals rock cement asphalt tar oil grease glass crockery rubber tires bottles cans lumber sawdust waste from animal packing or slaughterhouses or other materials usually created by an industrial enterprise infectious wastes means those wastes which may cause disease or reasonably be suspected of harboring pathogenic organisms included are wastes resulting from the operation of medical clinics hospitals and other facilities producing wastes which may consist of but are not limited to diseased human and animal parts contaminated bandages pathological specimens hypodermic needles contaminated clothing and surgical gloves junk means any tangible item such as furniture appliances bicycles excluding motor vehicles or similar property not having a useful purpose to the owner or abandoned by the owner and not included within the definition of the term garbage garden trash or rubbish multifamily dwelling unit means any building or structure containing four or less dwelling units held under common ownership and either under common roof or having common walls or a cooperative agreement for provision of services packer truck means a vehicle equipped with a packer unit hydraulically operated for loading and unloading of solid waste parkway means that portion of the street rightofway paralleling any public thoroughfare between the curbline or paving line and the abutting property line refuse means a combination of or mixture of garbage trash rubbish or any other solid waste materials residential improved real property means all singlefamily residences and multifamily dwelling units as defined in this section residential service means the collection service provided by a franchise holder to any residential improved real property rubbish means refuse accumulation of paper excelsior rags wooden or paper boxes or containers sweepings and all other accumulations of any nature other than garbage which are usual to housekeeping and to the operation of stores offices and other business places  also any bottles cans or other containers which due to their ability to retain water may serve as breeding places for mosquitoes or other waterbreeding insects service area means that exclusive area granted by a franchise issued by the city council to the collector for providing collection services under this article singlefamily residence means any building or structure designed or constructed for and capable of use as a residence for one family regardless of the type of structure such term includes a mobile home or trailer that is erected on a separate parcel of property and not located within a commercial rental park solid waste is a general term that includes the specific terms garbage garden trash junk rubbish refuse and bulk trash special service means excessive amounts of debris bulk trash or junk as determined by the director to be beyond the annual special assessment charge and for which the customer must contract directly with the collector or have removed and disposed of according to law special waste means any waste that requires special handling due to regulatory requirements or physical properties as determined by the director street means an open public rightofway or dedicated rightofway with passable access truck means any truck trailer conveyance equipment or vehicle used to collect andor transport solid waste upon or along a public highway equipment used for residential collection and sources of putrescible waste must be a packer type unit or alternative approved by the director i 32394 cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 penalty violations of this article are punishable as provided in section 115 i 32394 purpose the purpose of this article is to ensure that all solid waste generated and accumulated within the residential incorporated areas of the city shall be collected removed and disposed of by an authorized collector except as otherwise provided in this article in a proper sanitary and efficient manner to eliminate illegal dumping within the city to provide an effective method of collecting the special assessment charges provided in this article and to promote the general health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city i 32394 prima facie evidence of accumulation of waste the fact that any residential improved real property that is located within the city is designed for occupancy or is capable of being occupied shall be prima facie evidence that solid waste is being produced or accumulated upon such property collection charges may be levied against newly constructed residential property as a lien immediately following the initial connection of permanent electric utility service or whenever the first solid waste is collected from said property by authorized collectors of the city whichever occurs first i 32394 prohibited acts a it shall be unlawful and an offense against the city for any unauthorized person to do any of the following 1 place or cause to be placed any solid waste upon the property of another 2 deposit or dispose of any solid waste in or upon any public street sidewalk rightofway or alleyway or any stream ditch river pond creek park or public place in the city except in authorized containers 3 burn any solid waste generated or brought within the city unless all applicable permits have been obtained 4 place solid waste out for collection in any location not serviced by the collector 5 remove solid waste from any refuse bin or container from a collection location or from curbside 6 accumulate or cause to be accumulated any solid waste in or upon any premises or lot owned by him or in his control for an unreasonable period of time without providing for legal disposal 7 place out for collection any hazardous or infectious waste as defined in this article such waste shall be disposed of according to applicable law 8 fail to comply with any provisions of this article b the city incorporates the provisions of fs   the florida litter law as part of this article and a violation of said law may be subject to the enforcement provisions of this article i 32394 charge imposed  collection a there is hereby imposed a charge for the collection of solid waste on all residential improved real property within the city the amount of such charge for such solid waste collection shall be the rate established by the city council and from time to time amended as provided in this article the charge shall be imposed against the owners of all residential improved real property in the city regardless of the occupancy of such property b should the charge be increased the city council shall on or before october 1 of each year hold a public hearing to adopt a rate resolution incorporating a schedule of the collection charges to be imposed upon the owners of all residential improved real property in the city in addition such schedule may also include the monthly rates and charges the collector may charge for providing collection to nonresidential improved real property within the city and special services to residential improved real property c notice of said public hearing shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation at least 15 days prior to the public hearing such public hearing may be continued to a date certain without the necessity of further newspaper advertisement or public notice d collection charges incorporated in the rate resolution adopted under this section applicable to each parcel of residential improved real property within the city shall be the rate and charge for each such parcel for the collection of all solid waste generated on each such parcel except for special services e the owner and description of each parcel of residential improved real property shall be that designated on the real property assessment roll maintained by the county property appraiser the charge shall be due and payable as provided on the bill the charge shall become delinquent if not fully paid by the date on the bill for which the charge is imposed all delinquent collection charges shall bear an initial penalty of three percent of the full amount of the charge if not paid by the date on the bill for which the charge is imposed and an additional penalty of one percent per month on the delinquent principal amount on the first day of each month thereafter until such charge is paid in full f residential improved real property not included on the property appraisers assessment roll and not billed as a charge on the bill as provided in this section shall be billed a pro rata portion of the charge if applicable the total amount shall be collected by the city when permanent electrical service is authorized certificate of occupancy issued or solid waste collection service is authorized whichever shall occur first i 32394 state law reference local solid waste management fees fs   charge to constitute lien  delinquency a pursuant to fs   all charges imposed against the owners of residential improved real property within the city under the provisions of this article shall constitute and are hereby imposed as liens against such residential improved real property as of the date the charge is imposed or when service is provided until fully paid and discharged or barred by law such charges shall remain liens equal in rank and dignity with the lien of ad valorem taxes and superior in rank and dignity to all other liens encumbrances titles and claims in to or against the residential real property involved b if any charges become delinquent by not being fully paid by the due date for which the charge is imposed and remains delinquent the charge shall be subject to penalties for delinquent payment and issuance of liens with the potential for loss of title as provided in fs ch 173 i 32394 compensation of collectors a for purposes of this section the term annual rate of compensation shall mean the amount of money per residential improved real property within the area served by the contract collector for full solid waste collection services to be rendered by the contract collector to the residential improved real property within the city the number of residential improved real properties entitled to full service in each service area beginning october 1 of each year shall be multiplied times the annual rate of compensation and the result shall be the measure of contract compensation paid to each contract collector for providing full service within the collection contract area compensation shall be payable to each contract collector in monthly installments on the first of the month after which service has been provided less any outstanding debt or administrative charges owed to the city by the contract collector based upon the property appraisers records and the contract collectors records submitted the director shall determine the number of residential improved real properties the director shall provide monthly a list of certificates of occupancy issued for residential improved real property not billed for the service so that service may be provided and billed and the collector paid b in the event there exists residential improved real property entitled to full service and such residential improved real properties are not billed for the service or at the time of issuance of the certificate of occupancy referred to in this section as the unassessed residential improved real property then each contract collector shall submit to the director for review and approval a list of all such unassessed residential improved real property within the collection contract areas upon approval of such list by the director the contract collector may be directed to bill each of the unassessed residential improved real property within the collection contract area an amount equal to the rate of compensation or a pro rata amount if the residential improved real property has not received full service for the entire period or the city may issue the bill i 32394 exemptions a criteria exemptions from the charge imposed by this article may be granted by the director on individual parcels of residential improved real property meeting either of the following guidelines 1 the property is ten acres in area or more and is a singlefamily residence  or 2 the director determines that it would be in the best interest of the individual and the city to exempt the property from collection in addition each residence applying for an exemption under this section must demonstrate to the satisfaction of the director that the owner has a proper sanitary effective method of removing collecting and where applicable disposing of the solid waste generated on the owners property and that such disposal is being achieved in conformance with all applicable laws rules and regulations residents receiving individual exemptions shall not collect and remove solid waste generated on their property except in the manner proposed in the application for the individual exemption b procedure the director shall review the application and if it meets the criteria set out in this section the director shall grant an individual exemption upon the issuance of an individual exemption the director shall have the property removed from the solid waste collection charge records c appeals if the director denies the application for an individual exemption then within ten working days of the denial the applicant may make a formal written appeal to the city council the decision of the city council shall be binding and final i 32394 duties of customers  placement of materials for collection a all garbage garden trash and rubbish generated from a residential improved real property shall be placed by the customer in one or more garbage containers and placed at the applicable collection point on the designated collection day each residential improved real property shall be entitled to up to four 30gallon containers twice a week for garbage garden trash and rubbish any bulk trash or junk shall be placed at the collection point on the collection day designated for such collection excessive amounts of bulk trash or junk may require special service b hazardous industrial or infectious waste and special waste generated on residential improved real property shall not be placed for collection by the contract collector but shall be disposed of according to law c tree removal land clearing land development building demolition or home improvement debris shall be disposed of as a special service d the customer shall place all solid waste at the following collection points for the specified categories of property 1 for a singlefamily residence waste shall be placed at a point within the parkway abutting such residence no further than ten feet from the curbline or paving line or if no parkway exists which abuts the customers property at a point no greater than ten feet from the curbline or paving line or in the case of the existence of a drainage ditch at a point within such dimensions adjacent to the nearest driveway a customer who resides on a private road must allow access or place the container on the nearest public rightofway 2 for multifamily dwelling units waste shall be placed at a point designated by the collector in consultation with the customer which will maximize economy of collection of the solid waste while considering the public health and the convenience of the customer 3 collectors shall provide reardoor collection to certified handicapped residents unable to place containers pursuant to subsection d1 of this section without extra charge for this service 4 customers must ensure that containers may be picked up without interference from pets or other sources and that the safety of the collector not be threatened 5 containers shall be removed within 12 hours after collection and shall not be placed at the collection point more than 12 hours prior to collection 6 where road access is not passable by the collector the customer must place solid waste at nearest passable public rightofway e in the event of a dispute between the collector and a customer regarding the location of the collection point the collectors decision shall be subject to review by the director the directors decision shall be final and binding i 32394 secs 3810138130  reserved division 2  private collection services footnotes  3  cross reference businesses ch 18 collection contract required  terms and conditions contract collectors shall enter into a solid waste collection contract in the form of a franchise with the city for the sole and exclusive right and duty to provide for the collection of all solid waste from residential improved real property in a service area the solid waste collection contract shall set forth the following terms and conditions 1 service area the service area shall be that area within the city agreed upon between the contract collector and the city in which the collector has the sole and exclusive right and duty to provide for the collection of all solid waste from residential improved real property located therein if annexation by the city should occur the contractor collector shall be bound by fs  4 2 term of contract solid waste collection contracts will be issued for a maximum period of two years with an option to renew annually for up to three additional years application for renewal must be made within 180 days of expiration of the contract the contract shall automatically expire at the end of the term if the contract collector does not make application for renewal all contracts and renewals may be granted by resolution only after a public hearing and upon approval of the city council such contracts and any extensions thereof may be canceled by either party without cause upon one years written notice contracts for renewal are at the discretion of the city council the city council has the authority to enter into a contract for a service area by negotiation or by the bid process lowest and best bid after the expiration of the initial twoyear term 3 performance standards a routes  customer information card collectors shall establish routes within their service areas to obtain maximum efficiency of operation and shall file a copy of such routes with the director collectors shall supply residents in their collection areas printed cards containing information on rates if applicable general information consumer responsibility complaint procedure collection schedules holiday schedules etc all information on the cards must be approved by the director and may not be distributed prior to approval b right of city to deny routes the city reserves the right to deny routes submitted by any contract collector collector vehicles may be denied access to certain streets alleys and public ways where it is in the interest of the general public to do so because of street conditions bridge location or the nature of development of a particular area notice shall be given to the collectors by the director prior to such denial so as not to unduly interfere with a collectors normal operations c collection schedule with the exception of solid waste defined as bulk trash and junk contract collectors shall pick up and deliver to a solid waste disposal facility all solid waste placed by a customer at designated collection points on residential improved real property not less than two times per week with collections at least three days apart the collectors shall notify the customers within their collection areas of the applicable schedule of collection at least ten days prior to an alteration in said schedule d collection of bulk trash and junk collectors shall pick up and deliver to the solid waste disposal facility all bulk trash or junk generated from residential improved real property and placed at the applicable collection point on specified days twice a month excluding saturdays sundays and legal holidays customers placing excessive amounts of bulk trash or junk as determined by the director shall contract with the collector for special service to have such removed the director shall arbitrate the reasonableness of the fee charged the customer e collection on holidays collectors shall not be required to furnish collection services on the following specified holidays the fourth of july thanksgiving day and christmas day the collectors shall notify all customers whose normal collection day falls upon such holiday that no collection service will be provided on such day and of the date of the makeup collection day at least ten days and not more than 30 days prior to said holiday such notice shall be in the form of an advertisement in a newspaper of general circulation published within the city or individual notice  except individual notice must be given if the substitute collection day is not the next calendar day f required vehicles and equipment collectors shall use only vehicles commonly referred to as packer trucks unless otherwise approved by the director equipped with bodies which are watertight to a depth of not less than 12 inches solid metal sides and pneumatic tires collectors shall provide sufficient equipment to maintain regular schedules of collection and to promptly and efficiently perform their contracted duties g maintenance of equipment  identification on equipment equipment is to be maintained in a clean and safe working condition and shall be painted uniformly according to standards maintained from time to time by the director equipment shall display the name telephone number and vehicle number of the collector h vehicle covers each vehicle used for the collection of solid waste shall have a fully enclosed metal top the director shall have the authority to waive the requirement of a fully enclosed metal top in the event of an emergency as an alternative to a fully enclosed metal top such vehicle may be equipped with a cover which may be a net with mesh not greater than 1 inches or a tarpaulin  and such cover shall be kept in good mechanical order and used to cover the load in traveling to from and during the loading operation or when parked if the contents are likely to be scattered if not covered i cleanup of scattered waste vehicles shall not be overloaded so as to scatter solid waste  but when solid waste is scattered from a collectors vehicle for any reason it shall be the responsibility of the collector to immediately pick up such scattered solid waste collectors shall not be responsible for cleaning up unsanitary conditions around the solid waste containers caused by carelessness of the customer j washing and sanitizing of vehicles vehicles are to be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be washed thoroughly on the inside and sanitized with a suitable disinfectant and deodorant at such times as established by the director all vehicles are to be washed on the outside at least weekly k vehicles not to be left unattended  interference with traffic collector vehicles shall not interfere unduly with vehicular or pedestrian traffic and shall not be left unattended while in operation l time and manner of collection collectors shall make collections with a minimum of noise and disturbance to the occupants of the building and shall not collect from residential collection points prior to the hour of  am or after  pm containers shall be handled carefully by the collectors and shall be thoroughly emptied and returned and placed at least three feet from the edge of the pavement where possible standing upright and with covers securely in place if pushcarts are used the containers shall be placed in the carts m protection of customers property collectors shall use pedestrian walkways while on private property no trespassing or crossing property to a neighbors premises is permitted unless residents or owners of both such properties have approved care shall be taken to prevent damage to containers by unnecessarily rough treatment and to property including flowers shrubs and other plantings n authority of director the director shall decide any and all questions which may arise concerning the quality and acceptability of the work and services performed by collectors the manner of performance the rate of progress of said work the interpretation of the provisions of the contract and the acceptable fulfillment of contract duties in addition the director shall determine the amount quality and character of the work performed collectors shall have the right to appeal any decisions or findings of the director to the city council whose findings and conclusions shall be final and binding o cooperation with director collectors shall furnish the director with every reasonable opportunity for ascertaining whether or not the duties of the collector are being performed in accordance with the terms of the solid waste collection contract collectors shall designate in writing the person to serve as agent between his organization and the city 4 operation standards a supervision of operations  personnel collectors shall direct and supervise competent and qualified personnel and shall devote time and attention to the direction of the operation to ensure performance of obligations and duties as set forth in this article b office  office hours collectors shall provide at their own expense a suitable office located within the city and shall maintain office hours from  am to  pm each weekday in addition collectors shall designate a representative for emergency calls during the hours of  pm friday am monday c accounts collectors shall keep such uniform books and accounts as agreed upon from time to time by the city it shall be the responsibility of collectors to maintain said books and records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles the city shall have the right to audit said books and accounts at any time during normal business hours upon giving reasonable notice to collectors as to the time and place of such audit collectors shall maintain separate financial books and records of the operating costs and capital expenses pertaining to the performance of his duties under the solid waste collection contract d collectors not to be considered employees or agents of city collectors shall perform their duties under the terms and conditions of the solid waste collection contract as an independent contractor  and it shall not be construed or interpreted by virtue of such contract that collectors or their employees are employees agents or representatives of the city e special contracts the city may contract with other parties to collect and dispose of all or a portion of excessive amounts of trash debris or refuse which has accumulated by reason of any hurricane tropical storm freeze natural disaster severe disturbance riot or other calamity collectors may offer to remove and dispose of the excess debris or refuse within their collection areas at a rate to be established between the director and the collectors f annual audit if required by the city collectors shall provide annually at their own expense a certified audit performed by an independent certified public accountant such audit shall be performed in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards and shall cover the annual period ending not more than 180 days prior to may 31 and shall identify and separate that portion of the collectors business performed in their service areas audits shall include a balance sheet income statement statement of changes in financial position and other schedules as may be required collectors shall also make available to the city the work papers of the auditor in connection with the certified audit collectors shall be advised not to contract for audit services with auditors who will not make work papers available to the city failure of collectors to provide these audits timely may result in a fine of $10000 per day for each day the audit is received after may 31 if the certified audit is not received within the prescribed time the director shall notify the collector in writing if the audit is not received within 30 days of such notice the city may conduct its own audit in such event in addition to the late fee set forth in this subsection the collector shall be liable to the city for all costs including court costs and reasonable attorneys fees incurred as the result of delinquent audits upon request received no later than may 15 of a given year the collector may obtain an extension not to exceed 30 days for good cause 5 insurance  performance bond a workers compensation insurance collectors shall provide and maintain workers compensation insurance as required by law for all employees performing under a solid waste collection contract collectors shall not subcontract unless subcontractors provide workers compensation insurance as required by law b indemnification of city collectors shall indemnify and hold harmless the city from any and all liability claims damages losses expenses proceedings and causes of action of every kind and nature arising out of or connected with the performance of their duties under a solid waste collection contract c public liability insurance collectors shall provide and maintain at all times without cost or expense to the city policies of insurance generally known as public liability policies insuring the collector against any and all claims demands or causes of action whatsoever for injuries received or damage to property relating to the performance of the duties of the collector under the terms and provisions of a solid waste collection contract such policies of insurance shall insure the collector in an amount of not less than $30000000 to cover any and all claims connected with any accident or occurrence that may arise or be claimed to have arisen against the collector coverage shall include comprehensive general liability and vehicular liability the collector shall also obtain property damage insurance insuring the collector in an amount not less than $5000000 to cover the claims of any persons from a single or specific act that results in alleged damage to property such insurance policies shall provide that the city shall be entitled to 30 days written notice of any changes or cancellations of such policies d certificate of insurance a certificate of insurance indicating that the collector has coverage in accordance with the requirements set forth in this section shall be furnished by the collector to the director within ten days from the execution of a solid waste collection contract e performance bond the collector shall deposit with the city a performance bond or cash or certificate of deposit in lieu of such bond in an amount up to $10000000 interest earned on any certificate of deposit shall be delivered to the collector in accordance with the terms of such certificate the deposit shall stand as a guaranty to the city of the faithful performance of the contract and shall be forfeited to the city in the event the collector refuses to perform his duty under the terms and conditions of the contract or the contract is breached by the collector the amount of the bond shall be set by the director depending on the number of customers and shall cover a onemonth period 6 complaints a when received collectors shall record complaints on a form approved by the director and shall take appropriate steps to resolve the complaint within 24 hours after its receipt if a complaint cannot be resolved within that time period the collector shall notify the director on the approved forms of action taken to resolve the complaint collectors shall provide the director with a full written explanation of the disposition of any customers complaint involving a claim of damage by a collectors employees or agents b administrative charges shall be assessed against collectors if complaints exceed two percent of the total residential customers within the area served by a collector during any city fiscal year or if complaints exceed one percent of the total residential customers during any one calendar month a schedule of administrative charges for failure to perform specific contract duties shall be attached and made a part of the standard solid waste collection contract c administrative charges shall be assessed on a monthly basis and collectors will be notified at the end of each month in writing of any administrative charges assessed and the basis for each assessment the collector may contest such assessments in writing to the city manager within five days of receipt of the assessment notice appeals from the city managers decision shall be to the city council the city council shall notify the collector in writing of action taken with respect to the collectors appeal decisions of the city council shall be final and binding 7 termination of contract the director shall notify in writing the collector of deficiencies or default in the performance of his duties under the contract  and the collector shall have 15 days to correct same or to request in writing a hearing the city council shall hear and act upon same within 30 days from receipt of such request and shall notify the collector of such action the action by the city council shall be either to confirm in whole or in part the specified deficiencies or default or to relieve the collector of responsibilities for such deficiencies or default or find that there are no deficiencies or default or such action as deemed necessary in the judgment of the city council failure of the collector to remedy said specified items of deficiency or default in the notice by either the director or by the decision of the council whichever is applicable within 15 days of receipt of such notice of such decisions shall result in the termination of the contract  and the city shall be relieved of any and all responsibilities and liabilities under the terms and provisions of the contract in such an event the collector shall have the right to seek a judicial review of such action within 30 days of such action i 32394 service areas the city council shall have the power and authority to create exclusive service areas for any portion or the entire city and to enter into contracts for the collection of solid waste within the area the exclusive service areas may be for the collection of residential solid waste or commercial solid waste or both i 32394 streets of alcoholic beverages prohibited  65 use of rightsofway a consent required pursuant to the police power of the city the city council hereby determines in the interest of the health safety and welfare of its citizens that the use of any city rightofway including appendages thereto and the use of any public lands under the authority of the city council except for their intended purpose without prior written consent of the city shall be prohibited except as necessary for the maintenance responsibilities set forth in section 3053b of this code b commercial use the prohibition set out in subsection a of this section includes any commercial use including but not limited to the sale of and display for sale of any merchandise the servicing or repair of any vehicles except the rendering of emergency service the storage or parking of vehicles and the display of advertising of any sort c recreational use unless specifically designed for such purpose the prohibition set out in subsection a of this section shall also include camping sleeping parking except for emergency reasons and any other use that would tend to obstruct traffic along the city rightsofway including appendages thereto and to any other public lands under the authority of the city council without prior written approval by the city d penalty violations of this section are punishable as provided in section 115 i 4694   42011  ii 8112 secs 42374254  reserved article iii  special events definitions the following terms when used in this article shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this section advertise means the act of publicly announcing or calling public attention to a person thing place or event and shall include but not be limited to the distribution of handbills or mass mailings the use of outdoor advertising and announcements by radio television or newspaper bicycle path means a public way intended primarily for bicyclists at the side of a street or in or public park or other public property discrimination means any difference in the treatment or favor extended to a natural person including exclusion or segregation because of race color religion national origin ancestry or sex outdoor assembly permit also referred to herein as permit means a permit as required by this article outdoor public assembly also referred to herein as assembly or public assembly means any ceremony circus show exhibition concert pageant rally demonstration or parade which is held in or on any street sidewalk any public property or park parade means any procession march or assembly wherein the participants travel by foot vehicle or otherwise in or upon any street or public parking facility within the city parks means those areas designed on the city charter park and waterfront property map on file with the clerk of city council and incorporated by reference in the city charter public issue or political speech or conduct means that noncommercial expression of ideas of public concern related to government religion economics society culture and matters of a similar nature as determined by the courts of controlling jurisdiction be entitled to the greatest protection of the first amendment of the us constitution public property means any property generally open to the public owned by the united states the county or the state and any property owned by the city other than a street a park or a sidewalk sidewalk means any area or way set aside or open to the general public for purposes of pedestrian traffic whether or not it is paved street means any place or way set aside or open to the general public for purposes of vehicular traffic including any curb or shoulder parkway rightofway or median strip thereof  11696 activities exempt from this article this article shall not apply to 1 funeral processions 2 lawful picketing or other orderly processions on the sidewalks that do not constitute loitering 3 a governmental agency acting within the scope of its functions  11696 compliance by permittee with regulations a permittee hereunder shall comply with all permit directions and conditions and with all applicable laws and ordinances the assembly chairperson or other person heading or leading such assembly shall carry the permit upon his person during the conduct of the assembly and shall display the permit upon demand to any officer of the volusia county sheriffs office  11696 regulations of parking on parade route the volusia county sheriff or his designee shall have the authority when reasonably necessary to prohibit or restrict the parking of vehicles along a highway or part thereof constituting a part of the route of a parade the volusia county sheriff shall cause signs to be posted to such effect and it shall be unlawful for any person to park or leave unattended any vehicle in violation thereof  11696 required a no person shall conduct a parade or outdoor public assembly without obtaining a permit in accordance with this article b no person shall knowingly participate in a parade or public assembly on the city streets or in a city park or other public property for which a permit has not been granted  11696 application a any person seeking the issuance of an outdoor public assembly permit for the use of a park or for a parade shall file an application therefor with city manager or designee b the application shall be filed at least 30 days prior to the time on which the parade or public assembly is to be held an application for a public assembly permit for a parade shall not be filed more than 180 days prior to the event c where an applicantintends to engage in public issue speech or conduct and the parade has been planned or scheduled by the applicant for less than 30 days prior to the time on which the public assembly is to be held the application shall be filed at least five working days prior to the event if however an application is filed in a shorter time frame due to the exigency of the nature of the issue the city shall process such an application d the application shall be signed by the applicant under oath and shall indicate whether the applicant intends to engage in public issue speech e applications shall be on forms provided by the city manager or his designee and shall set forth the following information and such other information as from time to time may be required in order to allow the city manager to evaluate the application for compliance with this article 1 the name place of residence mailing address and telephone number of the person seeking to conduct the assembly 2 if the assembly is proposed to be conducted for on behalf of or by an organization the name address and telephone number of the headquarters of the organization and of the authorized and responsible heads of such organization 3 the date when the assembly is to be conducted 4 the type of assembly including a description of the activities which will occur during the event 5 the hours when such assembly will start and terminate 6 a description of any and all recording equipment soundamplification equipment banners signs or other attentiongetting devices including dimensions of and
