description of materials of any such banners signs or devices which will be utilized in connection with the assembly 7 the approximate number of participants including spectators which can be reasonably anticipated 8 if the assembly is designed to be held by on behalf of or for any person other than the applicant the applicant for such permit shall file with the city manager a communication in writing from the person proposing to hold the assembly authorizing the applicant to apply for the permit on his behalf 9 the exact location of the assembly and if the assembly is a parade the location by streets of any marshaling area or areas for such parade 10 a designation of any public facilities or equipment proposed to be utilized 11 if the application is for a parade the application shall also contain the following information a the time at which units of the parade will begin to arrive at the marshaling area or areas and the times at which all such units will be disbursed therefrom b the starting time of the parade and the approximate length of time that the parade will last c the route to be traveled including the starting and ending points d the approximate number of persons who and animals and vehicles which will constitute such parade and the type of animals and description of the vehicles e a statement as to whether the parade will occupy all or only a portion of the width of the streets or sidewalks to be used 12 whether alcoholic beverages will be sold or consumed at the event 13 a statement that the purpose of the assembly and the expected conduct of the participants will conform to all requirements of law and all ordinances of the county and the city 14 a statement whether the assembly is for the purpose of public issue or political speech or conduct and if so the specific purpose of the assembly and a general description of the proposed public issue or political speech or conduct 15 if the assembly is for the purpose of public issue or political speech or conduct the amount of funds available to pay the cost of city services and whether a claim of indigence is made on behalf of the applicant or the person on whose behalf the application is made and whether the applicant requests a waiver of fees costs and insurance requirements 16 the identity of the individual or entity which will be responsible for payment of city services 17 such parade or public assembly is not for the primary purpose of advertising any product goods or event that is primarily for private profit and the parade itself is not primarily for profit the prohibition against advertising any product goods or event shall not apply to signs identifying organizations or sponsors furnishing or sponsoring exhibits or structures used in the parade  11696 standards for issuance a the city manager or his designee shall issue a permit as provided for under this division article when from a consideration of the application and from other information as may otherwise be obtained it appears that 1 the conduct of the assembly will not unduly disturb the safe and orderly movement of other pedestrian or vehicular traffic contiguous to the route or location of the assembly {2 the concentration of persons animals andor vehicles at the assembly will not interfere unduly with proper fire and law enforcement protection of or ambulance service to areas contiguous to the assembly area or other areas of the city 3 adequate sanitation and other required health facilities are or will be made available in or adjacent to the assembly area and if applicable the marshaling area or areas 4 there are reasonable adequate parking places near the site of the assembly and if applicable marshaling area or areas to accommodate the approximate number of vehicles reasonably expected to be driven to the assembly 5 the applicant has secured the law enforcement and other city services if any required under section 4264 or has obtained a waiver of fees pursuant to subsection 4262c 6 if the assembly is a parade such parade is not to be held for the primary purpose of advertising any product or goods or is not primarily for profit  provided however the prohibition against advertising any product goods or event shall not apply to signs identifying organizations or sponsors furnishing or sponsoring exhibits or structures used in the conduct of the assembly 7 no outdoor public assembly permit application for the same time and location has been received which has been or will be granted 8 no outdoor public assembly permit application for the same time but in another location has been or will be granted where the law enforcement resources required for that prior public assembly are so great that in combination with the subsequent proposed application the resulting deployment of law enforcement services would have an immediate and adverse effect upon the welfare and safety of persons and property 9 no event is scheduled elsewhere in the city where the law enforcement or other city resources required for that event are so great that the deployment of law enforcement or other city services for the proposed assembly would have an immediate and adverse effect upon the welfare and safety of persons and property 10 if alcoholic beverages are to be sold or served proper permits must have been or will be obtained approval of a permit under this division article shall not eliminate the necessity for any other approvals for such sale or dispensation of alcoholic beverages as required by law or ordinance 11 participants in the assembly shall not use sticks lumber metal poles or other objects to display signs or banners at the public assembly 12 participants in the assembly will not violate the law in connection with the assembly 13 the content of signs banners or speech whether written or oral except to the extent that such content constitutes a violation of any applicable law or ordinance will not be considered by the city manager in acting upon the application b no permit shall be granted that allows for the erection or placement of any structure whether permanent or temporary on a city street sidewalk or rightofway unless advance approval for the erection or placement of the structure is obtained from the city manager  11696 permit fees costs  waiver a where an outdoor public assembly permit is requested a nonrefundable fee of $4000 to cover the administrative costs of processing the permit shall be paid to the city by the person applying for the permit at the time of filing of the application b if the application is for the use of city property or if city services shall be required for the assembly the applicant shall pay for the charges in accordance with a schedule of fees approved by the mayor and city council prior to the issuance of the permit  provided if the applicant is indigent and is engaged in public issue speech or conduct within the meaning of section 4255 the applicant shall not be required to pay any fee described in this section c if the applicant is claiming indigency and is applying for an outdoor public assembly permit for the purpose of public issue speech or conduct the applicant shall apply to the mayor and city council stating that the applicant wishes a waiver of a portion or all of the costs of processing the permits and other city services the city manager or the designee thereof or the city attorney or the designee thereof shall determine if the applicant fulfills the public issue and indigency requirement in order to receive a waiver of costs of the processing fee and city services d an applicant who is indigent and intends to engage in public issue speech or conduct shall not be required to meet the requirements of section 4263 e an applicant is indigent within the meaning of this section when the applicant is unable to pay the cost of city services required for a public assembly after the payment of basic expenses necessary for the continued operation and existence of the organization including but not necessarily limited to rent and utilities as proof of such indigency the applicant shall supply an affidavit of indigency together with such other information as is reasonably required in support thereof  11696 financial responsibility a the applicant for an outdoor public assembly permit for a parade and any other person on whose behalf the application is made by filing the application does represent stipulate contract and agree to indemnify save and hold harmless and defend the city and all of its officers and employees including employees of the county of volusia who provide contractual law enforcement services for the city from all suits actions damages loss liability and claims of any character name or description brought for or on account of any injuries or damages received or sustained by any person or property arising out of the applicants negligence or negligence of its officers agents representatives guests employees invitees or persons contracting with the applicant whether it be sole negligence or joint negligence with others in connection with performance under the public assembly permit or by or on account of any act or omission neglect or wrongdoing of the applicant its officers agents representatives guests employees invitees or persons contracting with the applicant b in addition to the requirements of subsection a no outdoor public assembly permit shall be issued for parades unless the applicant shall obtain and maintain for any and all activities associated with the parade not limited to the staging of the parade parade route and disbanding of the parade such commercial general liability insurance as shall provide coverage for the applicant for bodily injury and personal injury including accidental death as well as from claims for property damage which may arise from operations under the permit whether such operations be by the applicant or by any of its agents representatives guests employees invitees or anyone contracting with the applicant or by anyone directly or indirectly employed by any of them except to the extent that claim arises from the negligent or wrongful conduct of the city or its employees an occurrence type policy is preferred the city shall be named as a certificate holder and as an additional insured on the policy the policy limits of insurance shall not be less than $50000000 combined single limit each occurrence for bodily injury and property damage c at the time of the application for an outdoor public assembly permit for a parade satisfactory proof that the insurance required by subsection b has been obtained shall be presented to the city manager or his designee the requirement for satisfactory proof may be complied with either by depositing the insurance policy itself or by furnishing a certificate of insurance meeting the following specifications to the city manager 1 the insurance policy issued shall be listed and for each policy the type of insurance policy number expiration date and limits of liability shall be shown 2 the certificate shall designate the city as certificate holder and as an additional insured and shall contain a statement to the effect that the policies listed are in force and that in the event of cancellation or any material change in a policy affecting the certificate holder at least ten days prior written notice shall be given to the certificate holder 3 below the schedule of insurance in force the certificate shall include a statement substantially as follows the comprehensive general liability policy listed above includes coverage of designated premises and coverage for contractual liability in compliance with the provisions of of the debary city for a parade to be held on ____________  ____________  ____________  19 ____________  4 the certificate of insurance shall be signed by an authorized agent of the issuing company or companies and shall have attached a copy of a power of attorney evidencing the agents authority d if motor vehicles are to be included evidence of public liability insurance with the same limits on vehicles may be accepted in lieu of the insurance required in subsections b and c  11696 procedures for consideration upon receipt of a filed application the city manager or his designee shall determine the extent to which law enforcement and other city services will be necessary for the assembly for the purposes of traffic control and public safety this determination shall be based upon the size location duration time and date of the event the expected sale of alcoholic beverages the number of streets and intersections to be blocked and the need to detour or preempt ordinary citizen travel and use of the streets or sidewalks if possible without disruption of ordinary city services or compromise to public safety the event will be policed by regularly scheduled onduty personnel if additional city services for the assembly are deemed necessary the applicant for the permit shall be so informed the applicant shall have the duty to secure law enforcement and other city services deemed necessary at the sole expense of the applicant who shall prepay or guarantee to prepay the expense of such protection unless a waiver of fees and costs has been granted pursuant to section 4262 at the discretion of the city manager  11696 notice of denial the city manager or designee shall act promptly upon a timely filed application for a permit if the application is denied the applicant shall be notified by certified mail return receipt requested of the action stating the reason for the denial at least 48 hours prior to the event  11696 public issue speechprocedure a if a proposed parade or event involves a public issue speech the city manager shall within seven calendar days of the filing date of the application or by the date requested for the parade or event whichever comes first either 1 issue the public assembly permit and notify the applicant and appropriate city departments  2 issue an alternative permit and notify the applicant and appropriate city departments  or 3 refuse to issue the permit and notify the applicant of the refusal b a refusal to issue the permit shall be based on the standards stated in section 4261 c the city manager shall after consulting with the appropriate city departments and after considering the fee schedule approved by city council notify the applicant of an estimate of the dollar amount city services will cost d the notification required by subsection a3 shall occur within three days of the filing date of the application but no later than the scheduled date of the parade  11696 public issue speechjudicial review a if an application for a permit for engaging in an event parade or demonstration conducted for the purpose of public issue speech or conduct is denied or if an alternative permit for such speech is tendered by the city and rejected by an applicant or applicants the city shall either issue the requested permit or promptly initiate judicial proceedings for a determination of the lawfulness of the denial of the permit or where an alternative permit has been rejected the lawfulness of the tender of the alternative permit failure to notify the city within five days of the acceptance or rejection of the alternative permit shall be deemed a withdrawal of the permit application b if the issue for judicial determination described in subsection a is not heard and decided on the merits by a court of competent jurisdiction within ten days from the date that the action is filed or by the date for which the permit is requested whichever comes first the requested permit shall be deemed issued c the applicant may but shall not be required to comply with section 4269 prior to judicial proceedings being instituted or concluded  11696 alternative permits a where an application for permit is denied by the city manager in the interest of traffic control andor public safety the city manager may authorize the conduct of the assembly on a date at a time or over a route or in a location different from that named by the applicant an applicant desiring to accept an alternative permit shall within five days after notice of authorization accept or reject such alternative permit failure of the applicant to accept or reject the alternative permit within these five days shall be deemed to be a withdrawal of the permit application in considering an alternative permit the city manager shall consider the express purpose and the intent of the applicants initial request and shall not act to deny the applicant an appropriate forum for the event alternative permit an alternative permit shall conform to the requirements of and shall have the effect of a permit under this division article b in the event the mayor and city council grant a partial waiver of fees and costs pursuant to subsection 4262c the clerk shall notify the applicant by certified mail return receipt requested that payment of any fees must be paid or payment guaranteed prior to the issuance of the permit the mayor and city council shall instruct the city manager to recommend to the applicant an alternative permit whereby the event may be held without payment of any unwaived fees or costs in recommending the alternative permit the purpose of the event shall be considered in order to provide the applicant with an appropriate forum  11696 appeal procedure a any applicant shall have the right to appeal the denial of a parade or public assembly permit to the mayor and city council the denied applicant shall make the appeal within five days after receipt of the denial by filing a written notice with the city manager and city clerk the mayor and city council shall act upon the appeal at the next scheduled meeting following receipt of the notice of appeal b in the event that the mayor and city council reject an applicants appeal the applicant may file a petition for writ of certiorari to the circuit court  11696 notice to city officials immediately upon the issuance of a permit the city manager or his designee shall send a copy thereof to each of the following 1 mayor 2 city clerk 3 volusia county transportation engineer 4 volusia county sheriff 5 volusia county chief of the fire department  11696 revocation of permit a the city manager or his designee shall have the authority to revoke a permit for a parade issued under this division article instantly upon violation of any one or more of the conditions or standards for issuance as herein set forth or when a public emergency arises where the law enforcement resources are required for that emergency are so great that deployment of law enforcement services for the assembly would have an immediate and adverse effect upon the welfare and safety of persons or property b where public issue speech or conduct is involved the revocation of a permit shall be treated for all purposes as a denial of a permit under section 4267 and all provisions of such section shall apply thereto notice of revocation hereunder shall be given to the permittee by the most practicable and expeditious means available under the circumstances  11696 parks no additional permit must be obtained for a public assembly in a park other than a permit pursuant to this division article  11696 contents of permit each parade or public assembly permit shall state the following information 1 starting and approximate ending time  2 minimum speed of parade units  3 maximum speed of parade units  4 maximum interval of space to be maintained between parade units  5 the portions of the streets that may be occupied by the parade or public assembly  6 the maximum length of the parade in miles or fractions thereof  and 7 such other information as the city manager shall find necessary to the enforcement of this article  11696 public conduct during assemblies a interference no person shall unreasonably hamper obstruct or impede or interfere with any duly licensed assembly or with any person vehicle or animal participating or used in such assembly b driving no driver of any vehicle unless specifically permitted by an officer of the volusia county sheriffs department shall drive between the vehicles of persons comprising a duly licensed parade when such vehicles or persons are in motion and are conspicuously designated as a parade c parking on parade route or in area near assembly the volusia county sheriff shall have the authority when reasonably necessary to prohibit or restrict the parking of vehicles necessary to prohibit or restrict the parking of vehicles along a parade or an area needed for the safe and efficient flow of traffic to or from an assembly the volusia county sheriff shall post signs to such effect and it shall be unlawful for any person to park or leave unattended any vehicle in violation thereof  11696 discrimination prohibited it shall be unlawful for any permittee or any agent or employee of the permitee either directly or indirectly 1 to discriminate against any natural person by refusing withholding or denying to such person any of the services advantages facilities or privileges offered or available to any other person attending the assembly or by setting different rates or charges therefor or by placing or attempting to place any such natural person in a separate and segregated section or area at the assembly 2 to publish circulate display post or mail any written or printed communication or notice to the effect that any of the services advantages facilities or privileges of the assembly will be refused withheld or denied to any natural person on account of the persons race color religion national origin ancestry or sex or that the persons attendance and presence at the assembly is unwelcome or objectionable or that the person will be prohibited from mingling with other persons at the assembly because of the persons race color religion national origin ancestry or sex 3 to aid abet incite or coerce the doing of any act declared herein to be unlawful or to prevent or attempt to prevent any person from complying with the provisions of this section  11696 penalties a it shall be unlawful for any person to stage present or conduct any assembly or block party without first having obtained permits therefor as herein provided b it shall be unlawful for any person knowingly to participate in an assembly or block party for which permits have not been granted c it shall be unlawful for any person in charge of or responsible for the conduct of a duly licensed assembly or block party to knowingly fail to comply with any condition of a permit d any person violating the provisions of any section of this article shall upon conviction be punished by fine not to exceed $50000 or imprisonment of not more than 60 days or both  11696 taxation footnotes  1  state law reference finance and taxation fs   et seq  ad valorem taxation fs ch 192 et seq  occupational license tax fs ch 205 article i  in general secs 4614635  reserved article ii  public service tax footnotes  2  editors note  adopted nov 6 199 amended art ii in its entirety in effect repealing and reenacting said article to read as herein set out the former art ii  46364643 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from iiix adopted  of adopted nov 6 199 states of this however so much of city as currently exists shall remain in effect insofar as it imposes a ten percent 10% public service tax on local telephone service until such time as it is superseded by the imposition of a seven percent 7% public service tax on telecommunications service as contained in above codified as art iii of this chapter above shall take effect 120 days after the city shall notify the companies responsible for collecting the public service tax on telecommunications service state law reference public service tax fs   levied  amount pursuant to the authority and provisions of fs   there is hereby levied and imposed upon each purchase of electricity and metered or bottled gas natural liquefied petroleum gas or manufactured within the corporate limit of the city a public service tax in the amount of ten percent such tax shall be calculated levied and imposed upon each separate bill or statement for purchases rendered by the seller of the taxable item to each purchaser of such service the tax shall not be applied against any fuel adjustment charge which shall be stated separately on each bill the term fuel adjustment charge means all increases in the cost of utility services to the ultimate consumer resulting from the increase in cost of fuel to the utility subsequent to  the tax shall in every case be paid by the purchaser for the use of the city to the seller at the time of paying the charge by the seller thereof but not less often than monthly  11696 seller to collect pay over discount for sellers it shall be the duty of every seller of such utility service in acting as the tax collection medium or agency for the city as established by fs   to collect from the purchaser at the time of payment for each service any tax imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article it shall be the responsibility of the sellercollector to remit all such taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article whether or not such taxes were collected from the purchaser by the seller to the city by the 15th of the month following the month of collection accompanied by a form as required by the city for the orderly reporting and certification of the necessary information such collections shall be paid to the city by the 15th of the month in accordance with the provisions of this article by the sellercollector for all such taxes levied and collected the immediately preceding month if such tax collections are not received by the city until after the 15th of the month taxes not received shall be delinquent  11696 sellers failing to collect report or pay over to city it shall be unlawful for any person to continue to sell or deliver any electricity or gas within the city who shall fail to collect report and pay over to the city the taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the terms of this article  11696 exception for united states churches etc the tax imposed by this article shall not apply to purchases of electricity or gas by the united states government the state of florida and its political subdivisions as defined in fs  101 1991  or to any recognized church for use exclusively for church purposes  the purchase of natural gas or fuel oil by a public or private utility either for resale or for use as fuel in the generation of electricity or the purchase of fuel oil or kerosene for uses in aircraft engine fuel or propellant or for use in internal combustion engines  11696 maintenance of records and inspection by the city each and every seller of an item or service referred to herein in section 4636 above shall keep complete records showing all sales within the municipal boundaries of the city of such commodities or services which records shall show the price charged upon each sale the date thereof and the date of payment thereof  and such records shall be kept open for inspection by the duly authorized agents of the city during business hours on all business days and such duly authorized agents shall have the right power and authority to make such transcripts or copies thereof during such times as they may desire  11696 fee allowed to seller for collection and record keeping for the purpose of compensating the seller the seller shall be allowed one percent of the amount of tax collected and due to the city in the form of a deduction from the amount collected for timely remittance the deduction shall be allowed as compensation for keeping records and collection of tax and remitting the same  11696 tax may be computed on aggregate amount of sales in all cases where the seller of a taxable commodity or service collects the price thereof in monthly periods the tax hereby levied may be computed on the aggregate amount of sales during such period providing that the amount of tax to be collected shall be the nearest whole cent to the amount computed  11696 penalty for violation any purchaser willfully failing or refusing to pay the tax hereby imposed where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax and any seller violating the provisions hereof or any officer agent or employee of any seller violating the provisions hereof may be punished by a fine not to exceed $50000 or by imprisonment in the volusia county correctional facility for a period not exceeding 60 days or by both such fines and imprisonment the city may further bring suit to restrain enjoin or otherwise prevent the violation of this article and shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys fees if it prevails in such suit  11696 secs 46444665  reserved article iii  telecommunication tax footnotes  3  editors note see the editors note to art ii cross reference telecommunications ch 48 levied  amount pursuant to the authority and provisions of fs   there is hereby levied and imposed upon each and every purchase of telecommunications service as defined by fs   which occurs within the city and originates and terminates in this state a public service tax in the amount of seven percent such tax shall apply to the total amount charged for any telecommunications service provided within the city or if the location of the telecommunications service provided cannot be determined the total amount billed for such telecommunications service to a telephone or telephone number a telecommunications number or device or a customers billing address located within the city excluding public telephone charges collected on site charges for any foreign exchange service or any private lien service except when such services are used or sold as a substitute for any telephone company switched service or dedicated facility by which a telephone company provides a communications path access charges and any customer access line charges paid to a local telephone company however telecommunications service as defined in fs  5b shall be taxed only on the monthly recurring customer service charges excluding variable usage charges  11696 seller to collect pay over discount for sellers it shall be the duty of every seller of such telecommunications service in acting as the tax collection medium or agency for the city as established by fs   to collect from the purchaser at the time of payment for such services any tax imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article it shall be the responsibility of the sellercollector to timely remit all such taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article whether or not such taxes were collected from the purchaser by the seller to the city by the 15th of the month immediately following the month of the levy and collection accompanied by a form as required by the city for the orderly reporting and certification of the necessary information for the purpose of compensating the seller the seller shall be allowed one percent of the amount of the tax collected for remittance the deduction shall be allowed as compensation for the establishment of record keeping systems for keeping the records and for the collection and remittance of the tax  11696 seller failing to collect report or pay over to the city it shall be unlawful for any person to continue to provide any telecommunications service within the city who shall fail to collect report and pay over to the city the taxes imposed and levied pursuant to the terms of this article  11696 exemption for governmental entities churches etc a the tax imposed by this article shall not apply to purchases of telecommunications services by the united states government the state of florida and its political subdivisions or to any recognized church for use exclusively for church purposes b purchases of local telephone service or other telecommunications service for use in the conduct of a telecommunications service for hire or otherwise for resale are exempt from the tax imposed by this article  11696 audit and remittance of taxes a the city may at its sole discretion conduct an audit of a sellercollector at such times as it deems necessary to determine if the tax imposed and levied has been properly collected and remitted pursuant to the provision of this article each sellercollector of a taxable telecommunications service shall provide to the city upon 60 days notice access to all applicable records for such telecommunications service in an audit the telecommunications service provider shall be liable for only its taxable accounts collected corresponding to the information provided to it by the city any information received by the city or its agent in connection with such audit is confidential and exempt from the provisions of fs ch 119071 pursuant to the provisions of the open government sunset review act in accordance with fs ch 11914 records not located within the municipal limits of the city must be furnished by the seller to the city within 14 days of written demand should the seller fail to comply with the written demand the city may authorize an agent or officer of the city to conduct an audit at the location where said records are maintained at the sellers expense b it shall be the duty of the sellercollector to remit all such taxes whether collected or not the city reserves the right to bill and collect from the sellercollector for unremitted taxes as may be discovered from an audit  11696 penalty for violation any purchaser willfully failing or refusing to pay the tax hereby imposed where the seller has not elected to assume and pay such tax and any seller violating the provisions hereof or any officer agent or employee of any seller violating the provisions hereof may be punished by a fine not to exceed $50000 or by imprisonment in the volusia county correctional facility for a period not exceeding 60 days or by both such fines and imprisonment the city may further bring suit to restrain enjoin or otherwise prevent the violation of this article and shall be entitled to reasonable attorneys fees if it prevails in such suit  11696 rules and regulations authorized the city manager or designee is hereby authorized to promulgate and establish reasonable rules and regulations for the reporting and payment of the tax imposed and levied pursuant to the provisions of this article  11696 secs 46734684  reserved article iv  homestead exemption exemption granted a in accordance with article vii subsection 6d florida constitution and fs   the city council of the city of debary authorizes an additional homestead exemption for any person who has the legal or equitable title to real estate and maintains thereon the permanent residence of the owner who has attained age 65 and whose household income does not exceed $2000000 as adjusted annually by the cpi beginning  b in accordance with subsection 6d2 florida constitution and fs  2b any person who has the legal or equitable title to real estate with a just value less than $25000000 has maintained permanent residency thereon for at least 25 years who has attained age 65 and whose household income does not exceed $2000000 as adjusted annually by the cpi beginning  shall be entitled to make application for an additional homestead exemption equal to the amount of the assessed value of the homestead  5703  i 8713  applicability the additional homestead exemption available under subsection 4685a andor 4685b applies only to ad valorem taxes levied by the city the additional homestead exemption available under subsection 4685a shall apply to the fiscal year beginning  and the additional homestead exemption available under subsection 4685b shall apply to the fiscal year beginning  and shall continue until this article or fs   is repealed  5703  i 8713  exemption amount the amount of the additional homestead exemption available under subsection 4685a shall be $2500000 the amount of the additional homestead exemption available under subsection 4685b shall be equal to the amount of the assessed value of the homestead  5703  i 8713  requirements a taxpayer claiming the additional homestead exemption available under either or both subsection 4685a or subsection 4685b must comply with all requirements set forth in fs   and complete all forms and provide all documents required by the department of revenue and the property appraiser a taxpayer claiming either or both of the available additional homestead exemptions must file an application with the volusia county property appraiser no later than march 1 of each year and supporting documentation no later than june 1 of each year for which such exemption is claimed failure of a taxpayer to file the required application and supporting documentation by march 1 and june 1 respectively shall constitute a waiver of the additional homestead exemption available for that year  5703  i 8713  telecommunications footnotes  1  cross reference telecommunications tax  4666 et seq article i  in general short title this chapter shall be known and may be cited as the debary telecommunications   5698 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning franchise means the rights granted by the city to a grantee by which the city authorizes such grantee to erect construct reconstruct operate dismantle test use and maintain a telecommunications system in the city any franchise awarded by an ordinance in accordance herewith shall be a nonexclusive franchise franchise agreement means an ordinance enacted by the city in favor of a grantee which is enforceable by the city and grantee and which sets forth the rights and obligations between the city and grantee arising out of the franchise grantee means the natural person partnership domestic or foreign corporation association joint venture or organization of any kind granted a franchise by the city under this chapter and its lawful and approved successors grantor or city means the city as represented by the city council or any delegate acting within the scope of its jurisdiction public service commission or psc means the agency charged with the powers and duties conferred on it by ps ch 364 to regulate telecommunications companies and their facilities public way means the surface of and the space above and below any public street road highway freeway easement lane path alley court sidewalk parkway or driveway now or hereafter existing as such within the city telecommunications system or communications system means a system of cables conduits poles wires supports and other structures and appurtenances as may be reasonably necessary for the construction maintenance and operation of a communications system to be used by the grantee to provide for the transport of voice data and video signals over a fiber optic network as permitted by the grantees state and federal certifications subject to the terms conditions and exceptions set forth in this chapter  5698 intent the city finds that the development of fiber optic communications systems has the potential of having great benefit and impact upon the residents and business community of the city because of the complex and rapidly changing technology associated with fiber optic telecommunications the city further finds that the public convenience safety and general welfare can best be served by establishing regulatory powers which should be vested in the city or such persons as the city shall designate it is the intent of this chapter and amendments to provide for and specify the means to attain the best possible public interest and public purpose in these matters and any franchise issued pursuant to this chapter shall be deemed to include this finding as an integral part thereof  5698 rights reserved the city hereby expressly reserves the following rights to 1 exercise its governmental powers now or hereafter to the full extent that such powers may be vested in or granted to the city 2 adopt in addition to the provisions contained herein and in the franchise and in any existing ordinances such additional reasonable regulations as it shall find necessary in the exercise of its police power 3 renegotiate any franchise granted pursuant to this chapter should substantial sections of the chapter be rendered void by the federal communications commission florida public service commission or by subsequent changes in applicable federal or state laws the grantee shall also have the right to renegotiate the franchise in the circumstances set forth in this subsection 3  5698 compliance a grantee shall not be relieved of any obligation to comply with any of the provisions of the franchise or any rule regulation requirement or directive promulgated thereunder because of any failure of the city or its officers agents or employees to enforce prompt compliance  5698 alternative remedies no provision of this chapter shall be deemed to bar the right of the city to seek or obtain judicial relief from a violation of any provisions of this chapter the franchise or any rule regulation requirement or directive promulgated under the franchise whether administratively judicially or both neither the existence of other remedies identified in this chapter nor the exercise thereof shall be deemed to bar or otherwise limit the right of the city to recover fines penalties or monetary damages except where liquidated damages are otherwise prescribed for such violation by the grantee or judicial enforcement of the grantees obligations by means of specific performance injunctive relief or mandate or any other administrative remedy or judicial remedy at law or in equity  5698 existing franchises all telecommunications system franchises including amendments and extensions thereof in existence on the effective date of the ordinance from which this chapter is derived shall remain in effect this chapter shall apply to such franchises to the full extent permitted by law  5698 secs 4884820  reserved article ii  franchise required no telecommunications system shall be allowed to occupy or use the public ways in the franchise area or be allowed to operate without a franchise in accordance with the provisions of this chapter unless exempt by state or federal law  5698 authority to grant  terms and conditions of granting a the city may grant a telecommunications system franchise for all or any defined portion of the city the service area shall be the entire area defined in the franchise agreement the initial service area shall be that portion of the franchise area scheduled to receive initial service as stated in the franchise agreement b if the city shall grant to a grantee a nonexclusive revocable franchise to construct operate maintain and reconstruct a telecommunications system within the franchise area or a renewal of an existing franchise the franchise shall constitute a right to provide the services of telecommunications system as required by the provisions of this chapter and the franchise agreement the franchise agreement shall include those provisions of the grantees application for franchise that are finally negotiated and accepted by the city and grantee any franchise granted under the terms and conditions contained in this chapter shall be consistent with federal laws and regulations and state general laws and regulations if a conflict occurs in the terms and conditions of the franchise and the terms and conditions on which the city can grant a franchise the general law or statutory requirements shall without exception control any franchise granted is hereby made subject to the general ordinance provisions in effect in the proper exercise of the citys police power c neither this chapter as a whole nor any of its parts portions or terms shall be construed as granting or intending to grant to a grantee a franchise to use the citys public ways or other public places of the city or any portion of the system for cable television including but not limited to interactive and payperview television or any other uses not specified herein  but nothing herein shall preclude a grantee from entering into a contract for the use of any portion of the system with any person firm partnership or corporation  provided that such person firm partnership or corporation first obtains an appropriate franchise from the city and required certification from the state d nothing in this franchise ordinance shall vest in grantee any property rights in cityowned property nor shall the city be compelled to maintain any of its property any longer than or in any fashion other than in the citys judgment its own business or needs may require e the city shall not be liable to grantee or any other person or persons for any damage occurring to the property of grantee caused by employees of the city in the performance of their duties nor shall the city be held liable to grantee or any other person or persons for the interruption of the companys service by actions of city employees in the performance of their duties f it is understood that there are within the city various streets which the city does not have the unqualified right to authorize grantee to use because of reservations in favor of the dedicators or because of other legal impediments  therefore in making this grant the city does not warrant or represent as to any particular street or portion of a street that it has the right to authorize grantee to install or maintain portions of its system therein and in each case the burden and responsibility for making such determination in advance of the installation shall be upon grantee upon request city shall make available to grantee such information as to a particular property as it may have with respect to such reservations or other impediments g the right to use the streets herein granted is subject to the terms of all rights or franchises heretofore granted by the city and to the terms of all rights or franchises hereafter granted by the city to companies primarily engaged in the rendering of public utilities service h the city in the proper exercise of its municipal powers and duties with respect to its public rightsofway shall have access to all manholes of the grantee in such public rightsofway i in accepting the franchise the grantee acknowledges that at all times during the term of this franchise its rights shall be subject to all lawful exercise of the police power by the city and to such reasonable regulation of public rightsofway as the city shall hereafter by resolution or ordinance provide in the interest of the health safety and welfare of the public any inconsistency or ambiguity between the provisions of this chapter and any lawful exercise of the citys police power shall be resolved in favor of the latter  5698 establishment of requirements the city may establish appropriate requirements for new franchises or franchise renewals and may modify these requirements from time to time to reflect changing conditions to the extent permitted by law and required in furtherance of the citys police power such requirements shall be retroactive to franchises then in effect and shall in any event become applicable when a franchise is renewed any such requirements shall apply to all franchises granted pursuant to this chapter  5698 franchise nonexclusive any telecommunications system franchise granted shall be nonexclusive the city specifically reserves the right to grant at any time such additional franchises for a communications system as it deems appropriate  provided however that such additional grants shall not operate to materially modify revoke or terminate any rights previously granted to any grantee  5698 applications a applicants for a telecommunications system franchise shall submit to the city an original and ten copies of written applications and including an application fee in the amount of $500000 the application fee for renewal of a telecommunications system franchise shall be $300000 b applications for a franchise or renewal thereof shall include at a minimum the following 1 a clear up to date description of the identity of the applicant including but not limited to the name of the applicant the address and telephone number of the applicant the nature of the business entity evidence of the compliance of the business entity with all applicable law and a detailed statement of the corporate or other business entity organization of the applicant including but not limited to the following a the name and address of any parent or subsidiary of the applicant and of any other business entity owning or controlling in whole or in part or owned or controlled in whole or in part by the applicant b a detailed and complete financial statement of the applicant prepared by an independent certified public accountant for the fiscal year immediately preceding the date of the application hereunder or an annual report of grantee for such fiscal year or if grantee is a whollyowned subsidiary an annual report of the parent company which report sets forth audited consolidated statements of operations balance sheets and cash flows 2 evidence that all aspects of the applicants communications system comply with applicable zoning laws of the city 3 if franchise area does not include the entire city a map or maps of a scale of not less than one inch equaling 100 feet showing the precise geographic area for which applicant seeks a franchise 4 the nonrefundable application fee which amount shall be used by the city to offset direct expenses incurred in the franchising and evaluation procedures including but not limited to staff time and consulting assistance 5 a schedule of construction as established by the applicant showing by a logical geographic progression which public ways within the franchise area upon which applicants system shall be constructed by the applicant within each calendar quarter during the period of construction 6 a detailed statement setting forth in its entirety any and all agreements and understandings whether formal or informal written oral or implied existing or proposed to exist between the applicant and any person firm or corporation which may affect control or operation of the system contrary to this chapter or the franchise agreement 7 a copy of any agreement covering the franchise area if existing between the applicant and any public utility providing for the use of any facilities of the public utility including but not limited to poles lines or conduits 8 a copy of the applicants current and up to date certificates of authorization issued by the florida public service commission and all other authorities of jurisdiction for the provision of telecommunications services in the city 9 any other reasonable information which could materially affect the granting of the franchise as requested by the city c all of the materials and information required by the applicant shall be submitted no later than 45 days prior to the scheduled first hearing on the request for a new franchise failure to do so shall preclude the matter from being heard at a public hearing d the applicant shall be responsible for reimbursing the city its costs and expenses including attorneys accountants experts and outside consultants fees incurred in reviewing and evaluating the application an invoice shall be sent to the applicant for these costs and must be paid prior to final consideration of the request by the city council unless paid any approval of the city council shall be void ab initio the application fee and costs reimbursement are to defray a portion of the citys cost in processing an application they are therefore intended to be charges incidental to the awarding or enforcing of a franchise and shall not be deducted from the franchise fees imposed in a franchise agreement the costs shall be paid by the applicant  5698 grant procedure all franchise applications when filed shall be available for public inspection at places designated by the city no later than 60 days after the application is submitted the first of two or more public hearings shall be held on the application a decision shall be made by the city not later than ten days after the conclusion of the last of such public hearings based upon an evaluation of the application the hearings and other information that the city may deem relevant  5698 publication costs the applicant shall assume the cost of publication of any ordinance to grant a franchise as such publication is required by law and such is payable prior to final consideration of the request by the city council  5698 duration the term of any new franchise and all rights privileges obligations and restrictions pertaining thereto shall be as established in the franchise agreement not to exceed ten years unless terminated sooner as provided in this chapter  5698 limit on grantees recourse a except as expressly provided in this chapter and the franchise agreement the grantee shall have no recourse against the city for any loss expense or damage resulting from the terms and conditions of this chapter or the franchise because of the citys enforcement thereof the grantee expressly agrees that upon its acceptance of the franchise it does so relying upon its own investigation and understanding of the power and authority of the city to grant the franchise b the grantee by accepting the franchise acknowledges that it has not been induced to accept same by any promise verbal or written by or on behalf of the city or by any third person regarding the franchise not expressed therein the grantee further pledges that no promise or inducement oral or written has been made to any city employee or official regarding receipt of the franchise c the grantee further acknowledges by acceptance of the franchise that the grantee has carefully read the terms and conditions of this chapter and the franchise agreement and accepts without reservation the obligations imposed by the terms and conditions herein and in the franchise agreement d the grantee shall not apply for any waivers exceptions or declaratory rulings regarding the system from the psc or any other state or federal regulatory agency without prior written notice to the city  5698 fees imposed for the use of the public ways and for the purposes of providing revenue with which to defray the costs of regulation arising from the granting of communications system franchises under this chapter each grantee shall pay franchise fees in the amount prescribed by section 4831  5698 amount and payment of fees a the grantee in consideration of the privilege granted under the franchise for the operation of a communications system within the public ways of the city and the expense of regulation pursuant to the franchise incurred by the city shall pay to the city a sum equal to one percent of its gross receipts on recurring local service revenues derived during each quarter from calls originating within the corporate limits of the city excluding revenues derived from calls made by the city in the event the maximum franchise fee authorized by the laws of the state shall be increased beyond the current amount of one percent of the gross receipts on recurring local service revenues as prescribed in fs   the city shall be authorized to unilaterally amend this chapter and increase the franchise fee provided for herein to the maximum franchise fee authorized by the laws of the state  provided that the city increases the franchise fees for all communications system franchisees by an equal amount further in the event the maximum franchise fee authorized by the laws of the state shall be decreased below the current amount of one percent or eliminated in its entirety the city shall unilaterally amend this chapter and decrease or eliminate the franchise fee provided for herein to the maximum franchise fee authorized if any by the laws of the state provided that the city decreases or eliminates the franchise fees for all communications system franchisees by an equal amount b within 30 calendar days after the close of each fiscal quarter the grantee shall pay the franchise fee as provided in subsection a of this section and file with the citys finance director a statement signed by an authorized accountant or financial representative of the grantee of the gross receipts on recurring local service revenues derived in the preceding quarter acceptance of any franchise fee payment shall not be deemed a waiver or release of any claims the city may have for additional sums nor be construed as an accord that the amount paid is correct c in the event the grantee generates recurring local service revenues in any calendar year less than $100000000 such that annual franchise fees would be less than $1000000 paid to the city then the franchise fee shall be $1000000 per lineal mile of cable fiber optic or other pathway that makes physical use of the municipal rightofway and in no event shall the franchise fee be less than $1000000 on an annual basis said fee represents the citys determination of costs reasonably related to the inconvenience or impairment solely caused by the disturbance of the municipal rightofway and the reasonable cost of the regulatory activity of the city and the proportionate share of cost of land for such rightofway utilized by the grantee d the sums of money to be paid by the grantee to the city under this section are compensation and consideration for the use by the grantee of the citys public ways for the construction maintenance and operation of the system and are not taxes as allowed by the florida constitution the general or special laws of the state or any other ordinances of the city the grantee shall at all times continue to be subject to public service taxes fs   ad valorem taxes fs   and such other taxes charges or fees as may be lawfully authorized by the florida constitution the general or special laws of the state the provisions of the municipal home rule powers act fs ch 166 or the ordinances of the city e the grantee and its agents and outside contractors shall make available to the city or its authorized representative or agent during normal business hours the books records and accounts and other documentation of the grantee hereinafter collectively referred to as the reports that as reasonably determined by the city are necessary to audit and determine the accuracy of the gross receipts on recurring local service revenues or determination of lineal mileage of cable fiber optic or other pathway upon which the franchise fee payment is based in the event the reports are not made available in the city the grantee shall reimburse the city for the reasonable travel expense of the citys representative resulting from such representatives travel to the location where the reports are maintained and shall permit the city to make and remove copies from the reports including computer printout or other data upon request by the city or its designated representative the grantee shall provide a copy of its annual report to the psc and a copy of all telephone service reports required to be filed with the psc the city or its designated representative shall have the right during the term of this franchise to examine the reports  provided however that the grantee shall be obligated to maintain its billing records only for the period of time required by the psc and that any examination conducted after such period shall be confined to the billing records then available no later than 30 days after the request of the city or its representative the grantee shall supply to the city a copy of the reports such copy shall be in the media requested by the city provided that it is economical and practical for the grantee to do so  however in no event shall paper copies of requested documentation be deemed uneconomical or impractical the city agrees to keep all documentation and reports confidential except as otherwise provided by state law f the cost of the audit will be borne by the grantee if as a result of the audit the city determines the grantee has underpaid the franchise fees owed in an amount equal to or exceeding two percent of the franchise fees actually paid  5698 interest on delinquent fees any franchise fees which remain unpaid after the dates specified in section 4831 above shall be delinquent and shall thereafter accrue interest at the rate of 18 percent per annum compounded monthly or whatever greater or lesser rate as allowed by law until paid to the city and the grantee shall reimburse the city for the actual outofpocket costs of the city together with reasonable attorneys fees associated with collecting any sums of money that grantee is required to remit to the city pursuant to this chapter  5698 transfers a a franchise shall not be sold assigned or transferred either in whole or in part or leased or sublet nor shall title thereto either legal or equitable or any right interest or property therein pass to or vest in any person other than a parent corporation of grantee a whollyowned subsidiary of grantee or a corporation under common control with grantee without the prior written consent of the city which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld nor unduly delayed no such consent shall be required for a mortgage or other hypothecation as a whole or in part to secure an indebtedness b the proposed assignee must show technical ability financial capability legal qualifications and general character qualifications as reasonably determined by the city and must agree to comply with all provisions of the franchise and such conditions as may be prescribed by the city council the city shall be deemed to have denied a proposed transfer or assignment in the event that its consent is not communicated in writing to grantee within 60 days following receipt of written notice of the proposed transfer or assignment c the grantee shall promptly notify the city of any actual or proposed change in or transfer of or acquisition by any other party of more than 50 percent of the ownership interest of the grantee or the grantees parent corporation every change transfer or acquisition of control of the grantee other than to or by a parent corporation of grantee a whollyowned subsidiary of grantee or a corporation under common control with grantee shall make the franchise subject to cancellation unless and until the city shall have consented thereto which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld nor unduly delayed for the purpose of determining whether it shall consent to such change transfer or acquisition of control the city may inquire into the qualifications of the prospective controlling party and the grantee shall assist the city in any such inquiry d the consent or approval of the city council to any transfer of the franchise shall not constitute a waiver or release of the rights of the city in and to the public ways and any transfer shall by its terms be expressly subordinate to the terms and conditions of a franchise e in no event shall a transfer of ownership or control be approved without the successor in interest becoming a signatory to the franchise agreement  5698 indemnification by grantee a each grantee shall at the grantees sole cost and expense fully indemnify defend and hold harmless the city and in their capacity as such the officers agents boards council members consultants and employees thereof from and against any and all claims suits actions proceedings liability and judgments for damages or otherwise 1 arising out of or alleged to arise out of the award of a franchise to the grantee andor the grantees operation of the communications system under the franchise  2 for actual or alleged injury to persons or property including loss of use of property due to an occurrence whether or not such property is physically damaged or destroyed in any way arising out of or or alleged to arise out of or the acts or omissions of the grantee or its officers agents employees or contractors  3 arising out of or alleged to arise out of any claim for damages for invasion of the right of privacy defamation of any person firm or corporation or the violation or infringement of any copyright trademark trade name service mark or patent or of any other right of any person firm or corporation resulting from or alleged to result from the operation of the system in the city  and 4 arising out of or alleged to arise out of grantees failure to comply with the provisions of any statute regulation or ordinance of any federal state or any local agency applicable to the grantee in its business b indemnification expenses shall include but not be limited to all outofpocket expenses such as reasonable attorneys fees and shall include the reasonable value of any services rendered by the city attorney or his or her assistants or any consultants agents and employees of the city nothing herein shall be deemed to prevent the parties indemnified and held harmless herein from participating in the defense of any litigation by their own counsel such participation shall not under any circumstances relieve the grantee from its duty of defense against liability or of paying any judgment entered against such party  5698 grantee insurance a during the term of this franchise and all extensions thereof  the grantee shall provide pay for and maintain satisfactory to the city the types of insurance described herein all insurance shall be from responsible companies duly authorized to do business in the state of florida and having a rating in bests insurance guide of a+ or better all liability policies shall provide that the city is an additional insured as to the operations under this franchise the required coverages must be evidenced by properly executed certificates of insurance forms the certificates must be signed by the authorized representative of the insurance company and shall be filed and maintained with the city annually during the term of this franchise thirty days advance written notice by registered or certified mail must be given to the city of any cancellation intent not to renew or reduction in the policy coverages b the limits of coverage of insurance required shall be not less than the following 1 workers compensation and employers liability insurance workers compensationflorida statutory requirements employers liability$50000000 limit each accident $50000000 limit per accident $50000000 limit per each employee 2 comprehensive general liability bodily injury and property damage $500000000 combined single limit each occurrence 3 automobile liability bodily injury and property damage $500000000 combined single limit each accident 4 copyright infringement $100000000 combined single limit each occurrence  5698 bonds grantee shall exercise none of the rights granted by this chapter until evidence of compliance with the following bonding and preceding insurance requirements has been filed with the city of debary florida should the grantee fail to comply with said requirements it shall acquire no rights privileges or authority under the franchise whatsoever a bond 1 the bond shall provide the following conditions a there shall be recoverable by the city jointly and severally from the principal and surety any and all fines and penalties due to the city and any and all damages losses costs and expenses suffered or incurred by the city resulting from the failure of the grantee to faithfully comply with the provisions of the franchise or this chapter  comply with all lawful orders permits issued by any city agency or body having jurisdiction over grantees acts or defaults  pay fees due to the city  pay any claims due the city as resulting from judicial action  pay any claims liens or taxes due the city which arise by reason of the construction operation maintenance or repair of the telecommunications system 2 in the event the grantee abandons the telecommunications system at any time during the term of this franchise or any extension thereto the bond shall be forfeited in favor of the city in an amount necessary to compensate city for any damage loss expense attorneys fees and costs it has suffered as a result of such abandonment 3 at any time the telecommunications system is upgrading or rebuilding all or any portion of the system the grantee shall provide a performance bond in the amount of $25000000 until all construction is completed 4 the grantee shall also maintain at all times during the time of this franchise a performance bond in the amount of $20000000 to guarantee the payment of all sums which may become due to the city and also guarantee the removal of the system upon termination of the franchise b notice the performance bonds required herein shall be in a form satisfactory to the city and shall require 30 days prior written notice to the city and the grantee of an intention of nonrenewal alteration or cancellation the grantee shall in the event of any such intended cancellation notice obtain pay all premiums for and file replacement bonds or policies within 30 days following receipt by the city or the grantee of any notice of intended cancellation  5698 termination in the event the grantee violates any of the material provisions of this chapter the grantee shall cease to operate the system within the city for any consecutive period of 180 days during the term of this franchise except for causes beyond the grantees control or the grantee is precluded by governmental authority from charging the franchise fee provided in this chapter to its customers and it provides the city with written notice of its desire to terminate the franchise the city at its option may forthwith declare a forfeiture and termination of and revoke and cancel all rights granted under this franchise  provided that prior to termination by the city resulting from a violation by the grantee of any of the provisions of this chapter the grantee shall be served written notice by the city with respect thereto the grantee shall have 60 days after service of such notice within which to cure the violation or within which to present a plan satisfactory to the city to accomplish the same in the event of such termination the grantee shall within a reasonable time following demand by the city remove or abandon the system and take such steps as are necessary to render every portion of the system remaining within the public ways of the city safe and shall thereupon be deemed to have abandoned same in its entirety  and the same shall thereupon become the sole property of the city without payment to the grantee  5698 secs 48384850  reserved article iii  operational rules compliance with state and federal law the grantee shall at all times comply with all laws of the state and federal government and the rules and regulations of any federal or state or administrative agency  5698 authority for use of public ways a prior to the installation placement or removal of any conduits cables or pole lines or the start of any other type of construction on the public ways the grantee shall pursuant to the requirements of existing or subsequently enacted city ordinances obtain all permits from and pay all fees to the citys department of public works such permits shall set out the place date and time where the conduits cables or pole lines or other form of construction are to be installed or removed or where the construction is to be conducted all permit applications submitted by the grantee shall contain plans showing known utility facilities and specifications and letters of no conflict as provided by other utilities having facilities located where the grantee desires to place its conduits cable or pole lines or begin construction the grantee will not assert the existence of any vested rights if the city issues a permit further issuance of a permit by the city shall not be construed by the grantee as a warranty that the placement by the grantee of its conduits cables or pole lines or the start of construction is in compliance with any applicable rules regulations or laws the grantee shall file with their permit applications to the city bonds solely for the protection of the city with a surety company or trust company or companies as surety or sureties in the amount of $25000000 to protect the city from any and all damages or costs suffered or incurred by the city as a result thereof  including but not limited to attorneys fees and costs of any action or proceeding and including the full amount of compensation indemnification cost of removal or abandonment of any property or other costs which may be in default up to the full principal amount of such bond  and the condition shall be a continuing obligation during the entire term of any permit issued in accordance herewith and thereafter until the permittee shall have satisfied in full any and all obligations to the city which arise out of or pertain to the permit b any type of construction proposed by the grantee shall be subject to the city code and other regulations of the city pertaining thereto and shall be performed with the least possible interference with the use of the public way and to adjoining property owners and in compliance with the rules and regulations of the state department of transportation c any conduits cables or pole lines installed or placed without first having obtained the permits hereinbefore provided for shall be removed within 30 days written notice by the city to remove the same and in default of compliance with such notice the conduits cables or poles may be removed by order of the city and the cost of removal shall be borne and paid by the grantee d the grantee shall construct and maintain a communications system so as not to interfere with other lawful uses of the public ways to the extent possible grantee shall make use of existing poles and other facilities available to the grantee the grantee may erect additional poles so long as all applicable permits and consents are obtained the grantee shall use its best efforts to individually notify all adjacent property owners affected by the proposed construction prior to the commencement of that work such notification shall not be required for emergencies necessitating immediate repairs e notwithstanding the grant to use public ways no public way shall be used by a grantee if the city in its sole discretion determines that such use is inconsistent with the terms conditions or provisions by which the public way was created or dedicated or is being used  5698 conditions on public way occupancy a all transmission and distribution structures lines and equipment erected by the grantee within the city shall be so located to cause minimum interference with the proper use of streets alleys and other public ways and places and to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of property owners who own property adjoining any such streets alleys or other public ways and places b the grantee shall not in any way displace damage or destroy any sewer water main pipe or any other facilities belonging to the city or to any third party who placed such facilities therein by express authority of the city without the consent of the city and the grantee shall be liable to the city or to the third party owner as the case may be for the cost of any repairs made necessary by any such displacement damage or destruction and shall pay such costs within 30 days of grantees receipt of an invoice for same c the grantee shall at its own cost and expense replace and repair without delay any sidewalk public way alley highway waterway bridge or any other public place that has been excavated broken removed displaced or disarranged by the grantee in the conduct of its construction maintenance and operation of any portion of the system or as a result of the deterioration of any portion of the system and restore the same to as good a condition as it existed prior to the grantee commencing its work upon failure of the grantee to do so after 30 days written notice by the city the city may make such repairs and replacements as it deems reasonably necessary and the grantee shall pay the city upon demand all costs of such repairs and replacements the grantee shall to the satisfaction of the city maintain any repairs it makes pursuant to this section for a period of one year following the date of such repair d the grantee shall use all proper and reasonable care in connection with any work which it may do in over under or across any public way alley highway waterway bridge easement or other public place of the city in seeking to prevent harm damage or injury to persons or property therefrom e the grantee shall 1 produce and maintain a complete set of as built plans including but not limited to horizontal and vertical profiles within 45 days after completion of construction of any portion of the system  2 comply with all applicable laws regulations and codes promulgated for the protection of the public including but not limited to the national electric the national electrical safety the florida department of transportation utilities accommodations guide the state of florida manual of uniform minimum standards for design construction and maintenance for streets and highways and such other design or regulatory manuals which regulate the insulation of structures within public rightsofway  3 make such plans available to the city within 45 days after construction of any portion of the system  4 become a member of and maintain membership in a utility notification onecall system f the grantee shall not and shall prohibit any officer  agent employee contractor or subcontractor which the grantee retains from removing or substantially trimming any tree or major portion thereof either above at or below ground level which is located within a public way without the prior written approval of the city such consent may be given or withheld upon such terms and conditions as the city deems appropriate each grantee shall be responsible for and shall indemnify defend and hold harmless the city and its officers agents and employees from and against any and all damages arising from or resulting from the removal trimming mutilation of or any injury to any tree proximately caused by the grantee or its officers agents employees contractors or subcontractors g in the event the city requires the grantee to adapt or conform any portion of the system or in any way to alter temporarily or permanently relocate or to change any portion of same to enable any other person to use a public way avenue alley sidewalk highway bridge easement or other public place of the city the grantee shall be reimbursed by the person desiring or occasioning such change for any loss cost or expense caused by or arising out of such change alteration or relocation of any portion of the system h in an emergency as determined by the city when the grantee or its representative is immediately unavailable or unable to provide the necessary immediate repairs to any portion of the system that is damaged or malfunctioning or to any faults or settled or sunken areas that may develop in any area over around or adjacent to same the city when apprised of such an emergency shall have the right to make the repairs with the total cost of same being charged to the grantee i in an effort to minimize the number of facilities within the citys public ways the disruption of traffic and roadway destruction the grantee shall enter into joint use agreements with the city and other parties who are expressly authorized by the city to use its public ways provided such agreements are satisfactory to the grantee nothing herein contained shall mandate that the grantee enter into joint use agreements j the grantee shall maintain and operate all parts of the system in
